loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a hard-working woman who is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past seven months, Resty has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of sweet potatoes and bananas and will help Resty generate greater profits and stock more food. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand into a wholesale shop. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Myra Joy

texts.en: Myra Joy is 18 years old, single, and lived with her parents at Enrile. She is the second child among three siblings. She wanted to become a teacher someday. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay tuition fees. Her mother's income from selling snacks is not enough for all their needs. Thus she hopes this loan will be given to her as help for achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 54 years old and married to a tricycle driver. They are blessed with four children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income usually is spent on daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow PHP 35,000 to purchase noodles, charcoal, cooking oil, beverages, and breads. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and expand so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, charcoal, cooking oil, beverages, and breads.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Marietta has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 35-year-old, married woman with six children. She is a housewife and looks after her house and kids. Her husband owns a rickshaw and is a rickshaw driver by profession. Given their increasing expenses, her husband has decided to increase his earnings through adding another source of income.  He wants to buy a rickshaw, so that he can rent it out. He will save the amount he earns from renting it out, and he plans to use these additional earnings for educating their children. Currently they are short of funds, as the income only covers their expenses and they are unable to save. Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Brac, a Kiva partner, to help her husband increase his business. She and her husband are thankful and hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: to buy an additional rickshaw to rent out.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 46 years old, married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mónica  Isabel

texts.es: Mónica de 49 años de edad, conforma una familia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 25 años, y con ellos tiene como meta aumentar el bienestar de su familia fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo aumentando sus ventas y sus utilidades mediante el trabajo en su negocio donde vende mercancía variada. La falta de capital de trabajo para incrementar sus ventas y cumplir sus propósitos son su mayor desafío; pues aunque vende desde hace 15 años, ropa, calzado, accesorios etc, trabaja mediante créditos a sus clientela y para responder a sus pedidos, debe esperar a que estos le paguen la mercancía que ella le ha vendido. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cosméticos, detalles para el hogar, según pedidos de sus compradores; con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues aumentará el capital de trabajo, las ventas y sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Mónica is 49 years old and has a family made up of her spouse and their two children ages 22 and 25.  Her goals for them are to improve their wellbeing, strengthen her working capital, and increase her sales and her profits through her business where she sells miscellaneous merchandise.  

Her greatest challenge in increasing her sales and reaching her goals is a lack of working capital because even though she has been selling clothing, footwear, accessories and other items for 15 years, she sells on credit, therefore in order to fulfill her orders she must wait for her customers to pay for the merchandise that she has sold them.  For this reason, she is seeking her first loan from Kiva through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation.  She will use the loan to purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics and home accents to fulfill her customers' orders.  With this investment in her business, she will increase her working capital, her sales and her profits.

loans.use: purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics, and home accents.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 32, is from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Nary is a farmer who has a small rice field near her house. At home, she is a mother of one son who is attending a kindergarten in the village. So far, she has been in this career for 10 years and the average income that she can make is USD $5 a day.   

To increase the profit, she wants to enlarge her farmland so she can grow more rice and get a more fruitful harvest. Since she doesn't have enough money, she would like a loan from KHL to buy more farmland located next to her own farmland. With the support from this loan, Nary hopes that she could operate her expanded farming business and receive more benefit. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet's group comprises hardworking women. Harriet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Harriet has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food and utensils, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to continue with her education. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food and utensils.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice's group is comprised of hardworking women. Alice is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Alice has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, where she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials and threads, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to own a salon. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials and threads.

loans.name: Kizlarkhon

texts.en: Kizlarkhon was born in 1970. She is married and has five children. Kizlarkhon lives in an agricultural region. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five yars. Many people of her region are in this business. She raises cows and she has a cowshed at her house. Kizlarkhon fattens cattle for some months and sells the livestock at a local market where she has regular customers. She manages this business alone. Her husband Jurabek is a builder. Kizlarkhon is going to increase working capital and in this way hopes to develop the business. From profits she earns, she wants to improve her family's living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get his college degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: care for and fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Flor De Los Angeles

texts.es: Flor de Los Angeles, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche  para el gasto de la casa y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Flor de Los Angeles is 24 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her son and her husband, who are her top priority. With her loan, she intends to purchase a pregnant cow with a weaning calf. The idea is to take advantage of the grassy space that she has, the good land conditions, and the climate in order to have these animals. At the same time, she wants to obtain milk to cover the household expenses and raise calves to sell for meat in the future. With this purchase, she will be able to develop another business and also have enough savings to buy more animals and to invest further in the property. 

This is the first loan Flor de Los Angeles has received through Fudecosur. She hasn't had any other loans from state banks before, but Fudecosur has offered her this loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 65 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Belinda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Milton Alcides

texts.es:
Milton, es acompañado, viven con sus cinco hijos de 15, 13, 12, 10 y 5 años de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero; Milton es propietario de una marmolería, aprendió esté oficio siendo  empleado durante 13 años, luego tomo la decisión de independizarse, es así como hoy su negocio ya tiene 10 años de estar funcionado, su horario normal es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. y varía según la demanda de sus clientes.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar 4 cajas de mármol, contara con la materia primara para seguir trabajando y teniendo ingresos para subsistir junto a su familia, espera atraer nuevos clientes, resarcir su deuda con buena calificación crediticia.
Sus sueños son ampliar el negocio para que sea autosotenible y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Milton is married and lives with his five children who are ages 15, 13, 12, 10 and 5.  He does not have relatives abroad.  Milton is the owner of a marble workshop, a trade that he earned as an employee for 13 years.  He later took the decision to start his own business, and now, his business has been in operation for 10 years.  His usual work schedule is from 7am to 3pm but it varies based on his customers' demand.  

He will use the loan to purchase four boxes of marble, which he will use to continue working and generate earnings to survive with his family.  He hopes to attract new customers and repay his debt with a good credit rating.  His dreams are to expand his business so that it is self-sustaining, and to build his own home.

loans.use: purchase four boxes of marble.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida started the business of vending fruits in the market. When she got tired of traveling to import fruits and sell them, she decided to put up a barbeque stall. Sometimes she sells frozen foods in their village for additional income.

Florida is 44 and has one kid who is in college. She wanted to extend her business and earn a higher income to further bestow upon her child the needs for her studies. 

Florida wants to borrow money amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy raw ingredients for her barbeque business. She hopes to grow the business and have it become a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a hardworking woman. Aisha is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, bread, eggs, juice, Blue Band, and cakes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and maize flour and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Noemy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Noemy, tiene una familia integrada por su compañero de vida, dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad, es una madre ejemplar que le enseña a sus hijos a luchar para salir adelante; desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, dicho oficio lo heredo de su familia, atiende su negocio de 5:00 a.m. a 11:00 p.m., por el momento no tiene dificultades en desempeñar esta actividad.
Comprará maíz y leña al por mayor, para elaborar la venta de tortillas, al realizar está inversión aprovechara el buen precio de la materia prima y se ahorrara un poco porque se lo están vendiendo a buen precio, espera ofrecer mayor calidad y buen servicio a sus clientes así como también aumentar las ganancias.
Noemy aspira a tener un minisúper en el que ofrezca más producto a sus clientes, apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien en la universidad, dar una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud a su familia.
texts.en:
Noemy has a family with her life partner. She has two children, one is 16 years old and the other is 14. She is an outstanding mother who teaches her children to struggle to get ahead. She has sold tortillas for 20 years, a business in which she inherited from her family. She runs her business from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm. At the moment she´s not having any problems doing this. 

She will buy wholesale corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas. With this investment she´ll take advantage of the good wholesale prices and save a little because they are selling it at a good price. She hopes to offer the best quality and service to her customers to also increase her earnings. 

Noemy would like to have a mini-market in which she could offer more products to her customers and she would also like to support her children so that they could go to university. She wants to be able to give her family better food, clothing and health as well.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito para seguir en su negocio de venta de pupusas, tortillas, tamales y antojitos (enchiladas, enredos, tostadas y turrones, comprara 12 qq de maíz, tomates, aceite, gas propano, etc., para elaborar la venta y continuar teniendo ingresos para su costear sus obligaciones.
Para Claudia el crédito anterior tuvo un efecto positivo ya que mejoro su negocio, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten cancelar sus deudas y brindar a poyo a su hija para que estudie.
texts.en:
Claudia decided to ask for a new loan to continue with her business selling stuffed tortillas, tortillas, tamales and antojitos (enchiladas, enredos, tostadas and nougat candy). She will buy 12 qq of corn, tomatoes, oil, propane, etc. to make her products and to continue having an income to pay her bills. 

The previous loan had a positive effect for Claudia as she improved her business, she was able to pay her debts and support her daughter´s studies.

loans.use: to buy 12 qq of corn, tomatoes, oil, propane, etc. to make her products

loans.name: Luis Horacio

texts.es:
Una excelente cosecha de melón fue lo que obtuvo  Luis Horacio con ayuda del primer financiamiento brindado por Kiva a través de MiCrédito. Él está sumamente agradecido con los resultados de la siembra puesto que logró obtener buenos ingresos mediante la comercialización, lo que le permitió brindarle a su familia alimento y educación. Es un hombre dinámico, emprendedor y trabajador, es un excelente comerciante y agricultor, tiene la edad de 26 años, junto a su esposa, luchan para brindarle a sus hijos un futuro prospero. 
Hace un año Luis se dedica a la comercialización de arroz marca oro, razón principal por la que solicita el segundo crédito, requiere elevar la compra de arroz de manera que pueda cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su objetivo principal es mantener su negocio en auge, ganar día a día más clientes y así lograr incrementar los ingresos. Con ánimos y mucho esfuerzo trabaja para poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Horacio got an excellent melon harvest with the help of his first Kiva loan through MiCrédito.  He is extremely grateful for the results with his crop, given that he managed to get good income upon selling it.  This allowed him to give his family food and education.  He is a dynamic, enterprising, and hard-working man.  He is an excellent merchant and farmer.  He is 26 years old, and, together with his wife, he struggles to give their children a prosperous future.

Luis has devoted himself to selling gold brand rice for a year.  That is the main reason that he is requesting the second loan.  He needs to boost his rice purchase so that he is able to meet his customer demand.  

His main objective is to keep his business booming and to get more customers every day.  This way he will manage to increase his income.  With energy and a lot of effort, he works in order to be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice to be able to meet his customer demand.

loans.name: Deysi Esmeralda

texts.es:
Deysi, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos; su negocio se trata de vender frutas y verduras funciona desde hace ocho años, lo aprendió de su mamá, al desempeñar esta actividad puede tener ingresos económicos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para comprar futas y verduras, tales como: repollos, fresas, manzanas, pipianes, ejotes, sandias, mamones, papayas, tomates, etc., para surtir mejor su negocio con productos frescos, espera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son crecer son su negocio, trabajar con capital propio, cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  Her business consists of selling fruits and vegetables and has been going for eight years.  She learned it from her mother.  Performing this activity, she has the economic income to support her husband in their household expenses.
She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as: cabbage, strawberries, apples, squashes, green beans, watermelons, lychees, papayas, tomatoes, etc. in order to better supply her business with fresh products.  She hopes to satisfy the demand of her customers and have better profits.
Her dreams are to grow her business, work with her own capital, pay off her debts, and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to better supply her business with fresh products.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a married man born in 1986. He works in a construction business and has specialized in concrete work for 12 years.

In 2007, he started his own business after acquiring wide experience in his domain. He proved to be a hard worker with a very good reputation in his region.  Ahmad’s financial situation is not very stable, so currently he can’t afford to pay for sudden unexpected needs.

Today he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his wife’s baby delivery expenses since they are expecting their first baby soon. Ahmad is waiting anxiously for his baby to come into the world, and he always hopes to improve and expand his work to increase his family’s income and save profits to plan a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s baby delivery expenses since they are expecting their first baby soon

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 45 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Merlyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Merlyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Milalula

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Milalula works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Milalula successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested this additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Bun, 52, is a farmer on a small rice field near her house. At home, she is the mother of two married children and one adolescent who is attending a high school in the village. So far, she has been a farmer for more than thirty years, and the average income that she can make is 6 USD a day.   

To increase her family income, she wants to raise cows and sell them when they are big enough for the market needs. As she is lacking capital investment, she would like to borrow a loan from KHL to buy some baby cows for raising and selling. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can help improve her income as well as promote her family's living standards. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 32 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Jesusa works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Jesusa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Jercita

texts.en:
Jercita works hard to support her family. Jercita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Jercita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Jercita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 46, is a smallholder farmer from the village of Mutati in Central Kenya. He is a husband to a lovely 29-year-old spouse, and they have been blessed with 4 children. Simon has been doing mixed farming for 12 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and other personal businesses.

Simon is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. There is so much growth opportunity in the chicken business in Kenya. The demand for poultry products is always high, especially during the festive seasons. Simon has always had chickens but only recently has moved from a subsistence basis to a commercial one. He dreams of expanding the business but he is constrained financially. With the help of a loan, he has plans to acquire several fowls. From this acquisition, he will be in a position to produce many eggs and meat for sale in the local market.

The income generated from the sale of the poultry products will help Simon to afford his children’s growing education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Lilia has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Yeng, 34, is a farmer in small rice farmland near his house. He has two dependent children who are attending a primary school in the village. So far, he has been a farmer for more than thirty years and the average income that he can make is USD 7.00 a day.   

To increase his family income, he wants to raise ducks and sell them when they are big enough for marketing. He would like a loan from KHL to buy some baby ducks for raise-and-sell.  With the support from this loan, he hopes that his income will improve, as well as promote his family living standards. He also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy ducks for raise-and-sell

loans.name: Arão

texts.pt:
VIÚVO DE 53 ANOS DE IDADE, PAI DE 5 FILHOS TODOS MAIORES DE IDADE E ESTANDO A CUIDAR DE 5 NETOS QUE VIVEM CONSIGO. TEM NIVEL MEDIO E TRABALHA COMO MOTORISTA NA CRUZ VERMELHA DE MOCAMBIQUE. ESTA A TOMAR O CREDITO PELA 1ª VEZ.
PRETENDE COMPRAR PINTOS, RAÇÃO, VITAMINAS E VACINAS PARA AUMENTAR A SUA CRIAÇÃO DE FRANGOS PARA ABATE.
SEU DESEJO É DE PODER AMPlIAR A SUA CRIAÇÃO E SE TORNAR UM GRANDE CRIADOR DE FRANGOS.
SEU MAIOR DESAFIO É A FALTA DE FUNDOS PARA A CONSTRUÇÃO DE NOVAS CAPOEIRAS.
texts.en:
Arão, a widower from the age of 53, is the father of 5 children who are all of age and he is supporting 5 grandchildren who live with him. He has some schooling and currently works as a driver for the Red Cross in Mozambique.

He's asking for a loan for the first time. He plans to buy chicks, ration, vitamins and vaccines to expand his business raising hens for slaughter.

His wish is to be able to expand his business and become a great chicken breeder.
His greatest challenge is the lack of funds with which to build new chicken coops.

loans.use: buy chicks, ration, vitamins and vaccines to expand his business raising hens for slaughter

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello Lender,
Meet John. He is a smallholder farmer based in Murang’a area of Kenya, which is renowned for its expansive pineapple plantations. He lives together with his spouse and three children on a small parcel of land where he has been doing agriculture for the last 12 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and a few other varieties of food crops.
John is seeking a loan for purchasing a chaff cutter and constructing a dairy shed. During the years as a farmer, he came to appreciate that dairy farming is a sustainable venture that has seen him make regular income enough to keep his family’s simple lifestyle going. John’s strategy is to focus more on the dairy side of his activities. However, he lacks the finances necessary to make improved adjustments for a better state of his dairy farm
With your funding, John will construct a cow shed that will create a better environment for dairy management and animal health. A cowshed is also necessary for the introduction of zero-grazing. The chaff cutter, on the other hand, will cleanly and evenly chop hay into small pieces for feeding to livestock. Because of hay’s small size as a result, it will mix well with other feeds to balance a ration. This way, livestock are encouraged to eat more, with less chance of selecting particular parts of their ration, and so there can be less wastage.
Extra income realized from these improvements will go to John’s children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter and construct a cow shed

loans.name: Cielito

texts.en: Using her bicycle with cart, Cielito is able to take around her snack foods and frozen foods in their village. Cielito is already seven years running the business, while her husband works as a warehouseman. Cielito has three children. Through their income, they are able to give the better way of living for their children. Cielito is willing to suffer just to have a comfortable living. She is willing to do everything for her family. Cielito wants a loan of P18,000 to buy snack foods, and frozen foods to vend. Cielito believes that all hardship in life has a reward.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, and frozen foods to vend.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es casado y vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad, Jorge es profesor pero también vende abarrotes en una tienda y necesita credito para comprar arroz y azucar  para su tienda Jorge es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Jorge is married, and lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that he owns. 

Jorge is a teacher but he also sells groceries in a store and needs a loan to purchase rice and sugar for his store. Jorge provides the only source of income for his household, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Tự

texts.en:
Mrs. Tự works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Tự is 46 years old. She is married and has one child.  Tự lives  in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tự joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tự has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tự has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Tự faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and water tank.

With her business profit, Tự hopes to build a new house for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and water tank

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business, like rice, sugar, and milk.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Djamaladdin

texts.en: Djamaladdin is 28 years old. He is an IDP-Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli city, He now is living in Ahmadbayli village of Fuzuli region. He is single and is living with his parents and sister.  After his military service, he decided to continue their family business and since then he has been in the animal breeding business. Today Djamaladdin needs a loan in the amount of 1100-Azerbaijan New Manat to vaccinate his animals. He says great thanks to Kiva organization for the loan.  Djamaladdin is engaged.  He wants to increase his business and monthly income and then wants to get married.

loans.use: to pay for vaccination of his animals

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is the featured borrower of Apple group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.
Jocelyn is a 42-year-old married mother of three, who works as a housekeeper to provide her family with a better living through the acquired income from her current job. Life in the Philippines is very expensive and job opportunities are limited.  Jocelyn is acquiring a loan to pay for her children's school tuition fees.
Jocelyn is the lady standing at the far right side of the picture with the orange top. As for the other group members, Cecilia is the lady at the center of the picture, while Alma is the first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides for her rice-growing.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable stocks to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Francisca

texts.es:
Lilian, necesita de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar  blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior entre otras prendas de vestir para seguir manteniendo su venta de ropa en el mercado.
Su negocio ha crecido con la ayudo del préstamo anterior, tiene nuevos clientes, logro cambiar el estilo de vida familiar, su núcleo familiar se mantiene.
texts.en:
Lilian needs a new loan in order to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, undergarments, among other clothing items, in order to continue maintaining her clothing sales in the market. 

Her business has grown with the help of the previous loan. She has new customers, has managed to change her family's lifestyle and her household stays together.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, undergarments, among other clothing items, to continue maintaining her clothing sales in the market.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Ruhiya

texts.en: Ruhiya is a person who always tries to get ahead. She is married and has six children. Ruhiya has land where she works from early morning every day. She grows mainly watermelon, melons, maize and tomatoes. She has been busy with this business more than eight years. Ruhiya sells agriculture products in a local market. She sows agriculture products twice a year. Now she is going to make a second sowing and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Marites has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Chelamie

texts.en:
Chelamie is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Chelamie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Chelamie has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
Roslyn is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and corn barns.

Roslyn has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and corn barns

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old.  She is married and has two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Lolita has been pig fattening  for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set, so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Tilia

texts.en: Tilia is 38 years old and married with eight children. With seven children in school, Tilia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Tilia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hard working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh fruits and vegetables. To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shallet

texts.en:
Shallet is a married woman. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Oenn

texts.en:
Oenn, 64, who is a lovely mother of only one son, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last twenty-five years, she has been involving in framing. On her farm land, she grows peanuts and sells the product to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

As she is getting older and older, she doesn't want to work in the field anymore because it is not quite as easy for an old woman to be a farmer. For a convenient way of making a living, she is now come up with a business idea. She wants to be a scrap dealer. Due to the shortage of capital investment, she would like get a Kiva loan to open a scrap business. With the supporting of this loan, she hopes that it can help her to earn profit though an easier way. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to open a scrap business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
With her generated income from providing services in her village, Angelita earns a better income that sustained the needs of her family. With her income, her previous loan used for paying the school obligation of her children was successfully repaid. Aside from this, she also raises pigs, selling them in town. To boost her pigs, she took a new loan to buy feeding supplies in order to get a better return on her income.
 
She has determination in improving her business as well as the their standard of living. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Lelis Rechil

texts.en:
Lelis Rechil is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lelis Rechil requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lelis Rechil has been farming sugarcane for three years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lelis Rechil would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en:
Milly's group is comprised of  hardworking women. Milly is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past six months, Milly has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which rears chicken. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken birds and feeds, and will help Milly to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and her siblings. Milly hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a beauty salon. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicken birds and feeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and rice barns for her pigs. Maricel has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and rice barns for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 51 years old and has four children. Susie is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Susie requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Susie has been pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Jenner

texts.es:
Alex Jenner tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el Caserio de Las Juntas, Distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de arado con yunta, viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 7 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte por mototaxi, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de un toro para arar mejor su campo y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Alex Jenner is 38 years old and lives in Caserio de Las Juntas, in the Pomahuaca District, in a community of hot weather and a quiet population that lives off agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaen which belongs to the Cajamarca region, within the Northern Peruvian mountain range. 

He provides his services plowing the soil with an oxen, has been doing so for 7 years. He also makes a living providing transportation services in a rickshaw.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 soles to buy an oxen to better plow his fields and thus generate additional revenue for a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: invest in buying an oxen.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old, married and has one child. 

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilder Estamislao

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios como mototaxista, realizando esta actividad desde hace 3 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como obrero en una empresa, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para arreglos a su mobilidad y su domicilio y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilder is 43 years old. He lives in the Pucará district, a tranquil community with a hot climate, located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Its population makes a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock raising. 

He has been offering motorcycle taxi services for the past three years. Additionally, he works as a laborer for a company. 

He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN (Peruvian nuevo soles) to Edpyme Alternativa to make repairs to his vehicle and his home. In this way, he will be able to generate an additional income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in repairs for his vehicle and his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Loligen

texts.en:
Loligen is 32 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Loligen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Joanita's Group

texts.en:
Joanita's group is comprised of hard working women. Joanita is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Joanita has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joanita has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for the tailoring business and will help Joanita to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her siblings. Joanita hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business. 

Joanita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy materials for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Zumrut

texts.en: Zumrut is 46 years old, married with two kids. Zumrut has been growing vegetables for 12 years, which is how she earns an income. Her business helps her family meet their financial obligations and provide for their weekly, essential needs. Her husband helps her in this business. She learned when she was very young how to do this line of work. Zumrut decided to ask for a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) to buy manure and fertilizers to help maintain her vegetable farm and to improve the harvest. Her plan is to keep working to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristhofer

texts.es: Cristhofer, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes para aplicarle al cultivo de tiquizque y otros productos para aplicarle a la plantación y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra de trabajos en el terreno que requiere como lo son aporcarlo para que la planta tenga una condición adecuada para que tenga una mejor cosecha y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que alcance mas desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cristhofer, 23 years old, is in a civil marriage. He lives with his wife, who is his first priority. With this loan, he intends to purchase fertilizers to apply to his tiquizque crops and buy other products for use on his farm so the plants grow well.  Additionally, he will use it to pay laborers to work the land as needed so his plants have adequate conditions in which to grow so he has a bigger harvest.  He will also use it to buy agricultural products and maintain his plants in the future, so they grow and his farm keeps producing.He intends to take advantage of the good weather and soil in the region where he farms and his several years of experience working with these crops. He will buy the best products of the highest quality so that his plants grow well and the harvest is adequate and he has adequate short term production. With the income from the harvest, he wants to improve his family's well-being, pay for schooling for his family, fulfill his family's goals, and continue investing in future harvests. It is the first loan that he has received from FUDESCOSUR. He has not had any other loans from government institutions, but FUDECOSUR has readily given him a loan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help his tiquizque crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Maria Verna

texts.en:
Maria Verna is 29 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Maria Verna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like chips, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Maria Verna has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Maria Verna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like chips, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Stanley is 74 years of age and one of the most hardworking men in his village of Kiamuthambi, Kerugoya area in Kenya. He has a wife and 7 children and wanted to lay a good foundation for his family and grandchildren to come. That is why he started farming and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 43 years. His primary source of income has been eggs, crops and some personal business that he does so as to accumulate more wealth. Stanley is so passionate about dairy farming and, as he always says, “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He has nicknamed his dairy cow “Kibarak”.
Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed. This has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Stanley, being a very hardworking and visionary farmer, will want to take advantage of the ready market; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi kilimo to buy a good quality breed of a dairy cow. Stanley has already decided what type of dairy breed he requires and, because of the immense knowledge he has on preparing hay, his cows will never lack animal food and this means that there will be increased milk production.
Stanley projects that, through the loan, his cow will be giving out more than 10 liters a day and marketing the milk will never be a challenge because he will be selling it directly to the market as well as to big dairy-processing firms, which will result in increased earnings. Profits from selling milk will enable Stanley hit the jackpot. Stanley does not worry too much about competition because there is a ready market for milk.
Through the loan, Stanley has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will be packaging the milk and this will improve his income greatly. He also plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to construct a bio gas digester that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores.

loans.use: to buy a good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian, se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara una vaca parida, para mejorar la ganadería, espera aumentar los derivados de la leche para la buena alimentación de su familia y el comercio.
Con el capital anterior logro fortalecer su negocio, tiene un estilo de vida familiar más confortable, ha mantenido la buena calificación crediticia y está enseñando a sus hijos a alimentar el ganado.
texts.en:
Willian decided to request a new loan to use to buy a calving cow to improve his livestock. He hopes to increase the output of milk for the feeding of his family and the business.

With the previous loan he was able to strengthen his business, and he has a more comfortable family lifestyle. He has maintained a good credit rating and is teaching his children how to feed the cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calving cow to improve his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, es propietaria de un comedor y pupusería, ella compro este negocio hace ya 20 años, está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su localidad, lo administra junto a su esposo y han mantenido su continuidad generando con ello los recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares, sus hijos ya son independientes.  
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar un mostrador de comida para su negocio, de esta manera organizara mejor los diferentes tipos de comida que ofrece a sus clientes, también los alimentos se mantendrán calientes, espera atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar la imagen del establecimiento, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos que utilizara para cancelar sus compromisos actuales y la deuda adquirida.
Su visión es ampliar su negocio, crear fuentes de empleo y tener mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana owns a diner and snack bar.  She bought the business 20 years ago and it is located in the municipal market in her area.  She runs the diner along with her husband and has maintained the continuity and thereby generated the financial resources to cover the family expenses.  Her children are independent.

She will use the loan to buy a food counter for her business.  In this manner, she will better organize the different types of food offered to customers, also keep food warm.  She hopes to attract new customers, improve the image of the establishment, increase sales and income to use to pay their existing commitments and debt acquired.

Her vision is to expand her business, create jobs and have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a food counter for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre, vive en el municipio Jesús de Atoro, Santa Barbara. La actividad que le genera ingresos es la producción de café. desde pequeño a trabajado la agricultura con su padre. Tiene su propia parcela desde hace 5 años. El café lo vende en la misma zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras, para comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y lograr obtener mejor producción este año. Su meta es tener bien asistida la finca.
texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old, single, lives with his mother.  He lives in the town of Atoro Jesus, Santa Barbara.

The activity that generates income for him is coffee production. Since he was a young child, he worked at farming with his father. He has had his own plot for 5 years. The coffee is sold in the same area.

He has requested a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers to maintain the cultivation and achieve better coffee production this year. His goal is a well  cared for farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mahluqa

texts.en:
Mahluqa is 52 years old, married and mother of two kids. Mahluqa is a housewife and farmer. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing corn and cabbage for 15 years. Growing seasonal fruits is very widespread in Azerbaijan because there is high demand for fresh fruits. People use fruits to make juice, jam, fruit pies and fruit cocktails. People go to Mahluqa's grocery because the fruits there are always fresh and tasty. 

Mahluqa's income from this business is 400 AZN. She is applying for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Desde hace 14 años Ricardo decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, cuando quedó desempleado y varios de sus amigos, le comentaron que no tenían proveedor para su clientela, sus amigos justamente mecánicos de talleres de mantenimiento y reparación de vehículo, fueron quienes le permitieron observar el nicho de mercado en el cual incursionar. Así fue como inició con la venta de autopartes a los propietarios de vehículos que recibían los servicios en los talleres de sus amigos. Hoy su tarea la realiza a través de catálogos trabajando todos los dias que requiere su clientela, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. La meta de Ricardo es ampliar la cobertura de clientes y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará auto-partes y repuestos de vehículos, mejorando su negocio pues aumentará su capital de trabajo, las ventas y el volumen de sus ofertas..
texts.en:
Fourteen years ago,  Ricardo decided to start his own business venture.  When he became unemployed, several of his friends said they had no provider for the clientele, mechanical service shops and vehicle repair.  Friends were the ones who allowed him to observe the niche market in which to venture.

Thus was launched the sale of automotive parts to vehicle owners and providing services in the workshops of his friends. Today his work is performed through catalogs working every day as required by his clientele, from 8 am to 5 pm.

The goal of Ricardo is to expand client coverage and for this reason he applied for a loan.  With this financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo he willl purchase auto parts and spare parts for vehicles.  In this manner, he will improve his business and  will increase its capital, sales and volume of his business.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Emilly's Group

texts.en:
Emily's group is comprised of  hardworking women. Emily is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has two children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Emily has been working hard to manage her outside catering business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Emily has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chairs and flasks for the business, and it will help Emily to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Emily hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children in better schools. 

Emily is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chairs and flasks for the business.

loans.name: Maria Dalila

texts.es: María, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo, en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Este negocio lo tiene hace 15 años, en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante. Ofrece  ropa variada como, camisas, jeans,  blusas, trajes de niños, y tenis y zapatos.  El monto de su préstamo es de 10,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en  la compra de fardos de ropa usada, este préstamo le ayudara a tener más variedad de ropa y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband in the town of Choloma Cortes. She is engaged in the sale of used and new clothes.

The business is 15 year sold.  She sells from her home and also sells door-to-door.  She offers a variety of clothing such as shirts, jeans, blouses, children suits, and tennis shoes.

The amount of the loan is 10,000 Lempiras, with which she will invest in buying packets of used clothing.  This loan will help her have more variety of clothing and increase sales.  Her goal is to grow with the business.

loans.use: to buy packets of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Irma Dinora

texts.es:
Irma, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 8 años de edad, se dedica a cuidar de su familia y a brindar apoyo para los gastos de su hogar; su actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, frutas y verduras, lo fundo hace 3 años, por motivación personal y debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras y artículos de uso personal (jabones, shampoos, pastas dentales, etc.), para renovar el inventario de su negocio, ofrecer precios accesibles a sus clientes y tener más ganancias, espera recuperar la inversión y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son tener en un futuro un negocio más amplio con mayor rentabilidad y que su familia tenga una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her husband and son 8 years old.  She is dedicated to taking care of her family and provide support for household expenses. Her business is selling staples, fruits and vegetables.  She started the business three years ago because of personal motivation and because of the need to support her husband.

She will use the loan to buy fruits, vegetables and personal items (soaps, shampoos, toothpastes, etc.), to add to the inventory of her business, offering affordable prices to her customers.  Thus she will make more money, and increased return on investment and payoff their debt.

Her dreams are to have in the future a larger business more profitable and her family to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and personal items (soaps, shampoos, toothpastes, etc.), to add to the inventory of your business.

loans.name: Mama Simona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de carne, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers are members of the "Mama Simona" communal bank, located in the Poroy district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. One member of the group is Mauricia, who is 46 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children.

Mauricia works raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, helping them grow and fatten up, and then she sells them at various markets. With this small business she is helping her children get ahead in life. Her dream is to have her own store from which to sell the chickens and guinea pigs. Mauricia is asking for a loan to buy more chickens and guinea pigs, and food to feed them. 

Other members of this communal bank make a living doing things like selling animals, selling meat, running a small store, and selling prepared food. 

The two loan group members whose photos were added at the bottom left had to be photographed after the group meeting because of their work schedules.

Mauricia would like to thank those who help make her dream a reality through Kiva and she promises to pay back her loan installments as scheduled.

loans.use: buy chickens and guinea pigs, and food to feed them.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

For the past four years, she has operated an open air food business, selling to her neighbors and students to neighboring school. In addition she also has a farming business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café in the business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to stock wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for preparation of dumplings.

loans.name: Susana Trinidad

texts.es: Susana es una señora separada de su marido, ella tiene 6 hijas y un hijo, mismos que se encuentran estudiando, 4 asisten  al colegio y 3 están en la escuela, Susana comenta  que el padre de sus hijas vive en Perú y no les envía nada de dinero ni tampoco se ocupa de ellas, Susana  vive con sus hijas en una casa por la que paga arriendo y ella dice que muchas veces no tiene para comprarles ropa pero que lucha para no hacerles faltar el alimento, Susana  se dedica 8 años a comercializar granos, también compra cualquier tipo de cultivo que ya esté maduro y luego lo cosecha y ahí le queda la ganancia, también se dedica a cuidar una niña por la que le pagan algo de dinero, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un cultivo de papas para aumentar su negocio, lo que Susana aspira es mejorar su negocio para seguir adelante con sus hijas ya que es muy duro darles la educación, pero que quiere verles unas buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Susana is separated from her husband and has six daughters and a son who are all in school. Four are in high school and the other three are in elementary school. The father of her children lives in Peru and doesn't send them any money or help care for them. Susana and her children live in a rented house and she says that she often doesn't have enough money to buy them clothes, but that she works hard to make sure they have enough food.

For the past eight years, Susana has worked selling staple foods. She also buys crops that are ready to harvest, and makes a profit by harvesting them herself. In addition, she makes some money by babysitting a little girl. She plans to use this loan to buy a crop of potatoes in order to grow her business. Susana hopes to improve her sales so that she and her children can get ahead, because it is difficult to give them an education but she wants to see them become successful professionals.

loans.use: buy a crop of potatoes.

loans.name: San Martin De Tours Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Laura ella es soltera y tiene 59 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite,galletas y arroz.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE TOURS"; This bank is located in the district of Huarocondo, belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

The partner, Laura, is single and is 59 years old.  She has 2 sons. The partner works on her grocery business.  She sells products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm and has already has 5 years in this business.  She is doing very well and the dream of the woman is to expand the grocery business. The member requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice crackers.

Members who are included in the group photo they took the picture after the meeting because they asked for a work permit.
 
The other partners are in the business of selling pigs, selling animals, grocery store and restaurants.

The partner is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and undertakes to comply with the payment of their share by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice crackers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer luchadora, tiene 68 años de edad, es madre de familia de 2 hijos y vive en Calleria junto a su familia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder sacar adelante a su familia, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la venta de especerías, abarrotes, condimentos en un puesto que tiene en el mercado, gracias a ello pudo brindar educación y sustento a sus hijos y hoy está muy contenta porque ellos se están superando y es el mayor orgullo que puede sentir.
Irma está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder implementar el negocio y de esta manera pueda tener mayores ingresos. Gracias a ello poco a poco irá mejorando su calidad de vida y más adelante podrá ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma, 68, is a hard-working woman with two children and lives with her family in Calleria.  From a very young age she has worked to provide for her family and has more than ten years' experience selling spices, groceries and condiments at her stall in the market.  Through her efforts she has been able to provide for her children and give them an education.  Nowadays she is very happy because they are prospering which makes her proud.

Irma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she can buy merchandise for her business and earn more income.  With this help she will be able to improve her quality of life and later on expand her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Gricelda Evely

texts.es:
Gricelda, vive con sus dos hijos, uno de ellos tiene 16 años de edad está estudiando bachillerato, el otro tiene13 años y está estudiando 6° grado, es jefa de su hogar y procura cuidar de su familia lo mejor que puede; realiza la actividad de comercialización de ganado desde hace 16 años, su padre le enseño a desempeñarla, su horario es de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., sus clientes son los habitantes de la ciudad en donde vive.
Le servirá para comprar concentrado y profilácticos para ganado, con lo que dará una mejor alimentación a sus animales, espera mejorar su situación económica, seguir progresando con su negocio y  ofrecer una vida más digna a su familia.
Su visión es tener una ganadería más grande que le ayude a tener mejores ingresos para subsistir junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gricelda lives with her two children, a 16-year-old in high school and a 13-year-old in 6th grade.  She is the head of household and strives to care for her family the best she can.  For 16 years she has been selling cattle which is the trade she learned from her father.  Her schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and her customers are the locals in the city where she lives.

The loan she is requesting is to buy animal feed and prophylactic antibiotics for her cattle.  She wants to give her animals better nutrition in order to improve her economy and continue prospering in her business.  This is so she can offer her family a more dignified lifestyle.

Her vision is to have a larger cattle ranch to earn more money to live on together with her children.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and prophylactic antibiotics for her cattle.
