Desde hace 4 años se dedica al cultivo de cacao y le va muy bien porque ha aprendido el negocio muy rápido. También tiene ingresos porque cultiva plátano y se dedica a la venta de gallinas. Es una persona muy innovadora.
Meyster piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar insumos para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao, de esta manera la producción mejorará así como sus ingresos. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado porque con ello podrá apoyar a su familia y continuar con su trabajo para más adelante poder ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Meyster is a single, entrepreneurial young man. He is 22 years old. He lives in San Martin along with his family. From very young, he has supported his parents in the fields to be able to contribute to the home expenses. He is a very hard-working person and he likes what he does. He is familiar with nature. He loves the natural environment and at his young age, he has a lot of experience in agriculture. 

For 4 years, he has made a living from cultivating cacao and it is going very well for him because he has learned the business very quickly. He also has an income because he cultivates plantain and he makes a living from selling hens. He is a very innovative person.

Meyster is thinking about using the loan to be able to purchase supplies to sustain his cacao fields. In this way, the production will improve along with his income. He is very thankful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support that they have provided to him because with it, he will be able to support his family and continue with his work to later be able to improve his crops.

loans.use: to sustain cacao fields.

loans.name: Reina Emeli

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida, quien tiene 40 años de edad, y una de sus hijas de 24 años de edad, su negocio consiste en atender un chalet en el que vende comida rápida (panes con pollo, hot dog, refrescos, etc.) a los estudiantes de bachillerato de la comunidad, y una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 10 años de poseer su negocio. 
El préstamo le servirá para comprar pan, pollo, bebidas, embutidos, golosinas y otros productos para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, espera tener mayores ventas e ingresos con los que responderá positivamente a sus compromisos.
Su visión es mantener su negocio funcionando para tener una mejor situación económica  con la que tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar la alimentación, vestuario y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 48 years old, lives with her life partner, who is 40 years old, and one of her daughters who is 24 years old.  Her business is running a food stall where she sells fast food (bread with chicken, hot dogs, soft drinks, etc.) to the secondary school students in her community, and a grocery store with basic supplies. She has had this business for 10 years.

The loan will allow her to purchase bread, chicken, drinks, cold cuts, candies, and other products to increase her business's inventory. She hopes to have increased sales and income, which will positively meet her commitments.

Her vision is to continue running her business to have a better economic situation with which she will have the opportunity to improve her family's nutrition, clothing and health.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chicken, drinks, cold cuts, candies, and other products to increase her business's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Vyagiza Group

texts.fr:
Eric fait partie du groupe  Vyagiza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 26 ans et est marié à Aline, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 3ans.  

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, farine de soja,…) depuis  1 an. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  50 kilos de  haricot, 10 kilos de farine de soja et 80 kilos de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une moto et voir  ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Eric is part of the group Vyagiza and lives in Bujumbura. He is 26 years old and married to Aline, a tailor. Together they have one child, who is 3 years old.

Eric has been doing commerce in shop goods (beans, rice, soy flour, ..) for a year. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase 50 kg of beans, 10 kg of soy flour, and 80 kg of rice to resell, so as to earn more

In the coming years, he would like to buy a motorbike and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase 50 kg of beans, 10 kg of soy flour, and 80 kg of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Enrique Antonio

texts.es:
Enrique, tiene un puesto de venta de ropa y brinda el servicio de transporte en su pick up, su negocio nació hace 10 años y se ha expandido por sus esfuerzos de tener más  ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar; Enrique es casado, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, los cuales están estudiando.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar variedad de ropa para surtir el negocio en la temporada de vacaciones, espera tener nuevas prendas de vestir que sean del agrado de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Sus proyectos son crecer son su negocio, abrir otra sucursal para que sus hijos se involucren en el negocio y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Enrique has a retail location where he sells clothing and offers transportation services in his pick-up. His business was born 10 years ago and he has expanded it through his efforts to have more income to cover the household necessities.  Enrique is married and lives with his wife and 2 children, who are students. 

The loan will help him to purchase a variety of clothing to stock his business during the vacation season. He hopes to have new clothing that will please his customers, and increase his sales and profits.

His plans are to grow his business, open another branch so that his children get involved in the business, and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to stock the business for the vacation season.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, se decidió por otro préstamo con el que comprara sandias, papaya, piñas, mangos, etc., para vender picada de manera ambulante y en su puesto de venta, espera seguir trabajando y teniendo su negocio activo para generar los ingresos con los que sale adelante con su familia.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Felipa a mantener su negocio con materia prima necesaria para lograr cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, en su familia la cosas han cambiado favorablemente, pues ya incorporo a sus hijas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Felipa decided to request another loan to buy watermelons, papayas, pineapples, mangos, etc. She sells chopped fruits as a street vendor. She hopes to be able to continue working and keep her business alive in order to receive the income she needs to get ahead with her family.

Felipa used the previous loan to buy what she needed for her business in order to fulfill her customers’ demands. Her family’s living conditions have improved and her daughters are now working with her.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, papayas, pineapples, mangos, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gaje

texts.en: Gaje is a Babban Gona farmer from . Gaje is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Gaje to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Gaje can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Gaje is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, she will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Gaje is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes she would like to make, she said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Gaje will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alakanbenkelema Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe   ALAKANBENKELEMA   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme  CHIATA  1ère personne sur la photo de la gauche à la droite  compte acheter avec son prêt 1 sac de farine et 10 kg de sucre pour faire du pâté. Elle vend quotidiennement à KOLONDIEBA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte.Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group ALAKANBENKELEMA are married women, who average 30 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in FAKOLA, in Cercle de KOLONDIEBA, one of the prefectures in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at any time. They are on their second loan with the institution and very much intend to repay it. 

Ms. CHIATA, who is the first person at the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase a sack of flour and 10 kg of sugar to make pâté. She makes her sales each day in KOLONDIEBA and is much in demand, especially on market days. She gets her supplies in FAKOLA. She sells to a mixed customer base paying in cash

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Binetou's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été crée le 12 Novembre 2012 et regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier. Sata est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce de poisson frais au marché. Elle a plus de 20 ans d'expérience. Elle achète une caisse de poissons par jour pour le revendre dans le marché de sa localité. Avec ses bénéfices, elle participe à la prise en charge familiale notamment la nourriture, l'habillement, la scolarité, et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was created on November 12, 2012, and is composed of members living in the same district. Sata is the group’s official. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 12 years old. They are all in school. Sata does commerce in fresh fish at the market. She has over twenty years of experience. She purchases a case of fish each day and resells the goods at her town’s market. With the profits, she helps to cover family expenses, especially regarding food, clothing, schooling, and healthcare for the children.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Gambari

texts.en:
Gambari really appreciated the previous loan that helped him to expand his business.

For the past three years, he has been running a business selling clothes and shoes at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of stiff competition in his business.

With the loan of 100,000 KES that he is requesting, he wants to purchase more bales of clothes and shoes for resale. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Mahidahan

texts.ru: Махидахан, 38 лет, замужем, есть 4 малолетних детей. У Махидахан среднее образование, в 2010 году она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Махидахан на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1 корова, 5 овец, на земельном участке она выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Также на дому готовит блюда для дальнейшей продажи местным учреждениям. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махидахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с целью откорма и реализации. Махидахан хочет накопить средства на постройку собственного дома, так как на данный момент ее семья живет в арендованном жилье.
texts.en: Mahidahan is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four underage children. She has received secondary education. In 2010 she started raising livestock and growing farm produce, after having saved up 15,000 KGS as her starting capital. Thanks to Mahidahan’s hard work, her farm now includes one cow and five sheep. On her land plot she grows clover and corn. She also cooks food at home for selling to local organizations. Her monthly income is about 6,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Mahidahan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep for fattening and resale. Mahidahan would like to save up to buy her own house since at present her family lives in leased housing.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale in order to  earn a bigger profit and build a house for her family.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro siempre piensa en el futuro de su familia tratando la forma de cómo salir adelante el se a tenido que ingeniar la formo de cómo tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia motivo por el cual el a acudido a otro préstamo para tener otro capital para seguir hacia adelante con su negocio en la venta de ropa típica que el a tendido en su comunidad par sus ingresos económicos para su familia.

Con la realización de un crédito el tuvo la oportunidad  de poder emprender su negocio lo cual le resulto benefíciale para sus ingresos y para tener la experiencia de cómo pagar un préstamo y que le resulto con beneficios para el y su familia y también para su comunidad.

La inversión que el le dará al crédito es para la compra de un terreno que le están ofreciendo en su comunidad donde el vive oportunidad que el no piensa desaprovechar. Para un futuro construir casas para sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas.

Gracia al crédito que se le otorgo anterior mente el pudo sostener su negocio e invertir en las mismas y le generaron más ganancias solo así el pudo salir adelante en conjunto con su familia.

Los sueños de don Pedro hacia el futuro es la construcción de las viviendas de sus hijo para que ellos aprovechen al máximo el esfuerzo que su padre realizo y para que ellos tangan una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Pedro always thinks of his family's future. Trying to find the way to get ahead, he has had to devise a way to have an economic income to benefit his family, and this is the reason he asked for another loan to have more capital to continue onward with his business selling traditional clothing that he has had in his community to have income for his family. 

With the loan, he had the opportunity to be able to open his business, the results of which benefited his income and to be able to have the experience of how to pay off a loan, and it has beneficial results for his family and also for his community.

The investment that he will give this loan is to purchase land that is for sale in the community where he lives, an opportunity he doesn't want to pass up, so that in the future he can build houses for his children so they live in adequate conditions.

Thanks to the loan that he was granted previously, he could maintain his business and invest in it and it generated more profits, and only in this way was he able to get ahead with his family.

Pedro's dreams for the future are to build homes for his children so that they can take full advantage of the efforts that their father made and so that they have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en: Jamilu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Jamilu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Jamilu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Jamilu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Jamilu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is a 34-year-old man who lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province. He is a lovely father of two children who are enrolled in a primary school in the village. To make a living, he and his wife manage and operate rice farmland which is located near their house. They have been involved in this business for nearly twenty years. With great effort and hard work, this couple is able to make 6 USD in one day.

Net would like to improve their standard of living by having clean energy for household use. Because of their lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a small biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t have to spend much money on fuel, and that it will produce less smoke than wood or charcoal. 

He is very happy and thankful, because for this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate which is better than for its general loans. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot se sigue dedicando al negocio de bar,la socia vende gaseosas y cervezas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.mla socia ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de bar.La socia solcita el credito para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot continues working in her business which is a bar. She sells soft drinks and bears and she works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in this business for 9 years. Her dream is to expand her bar business.  She asks for a loan to purchase soft drinks and beers. 

She is happy for the loan and commits to making the payments on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Tata

texts.en: Tata is a Babban Gona farmer from Tashar Ango. Tata is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Tata to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tata can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Tata is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Tata is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Tata will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.es:
Glicerio tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Caserio Chorrillos que pertenece al distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropón que pertenece a la Región Jaen, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura ya que las cañas de azúcar son de su propiedad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para mantenimiento a sus equipos de destilación y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Glicerio is 33 years old and lives in a village called Chorrillos, in the Callayuc district. This area has a warm weather and its inhabitants are peaceful people who work in agriculture, commerce and cattle farming. It is located in the province of Morropón, which belongs to the region of Jaen in the northern mountain chain of Peru.

Glicerio works making “aguardiente” [an alcoholic beverage made from sugar cane]. He has been doing this for ten years. He also works in agriculture; he owns the sugar cane plantations. He requested a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles [PEN] at Edpyme Alternativa to be able to perform maintenance on his distillation equipment in order to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make aguardiente (an alcoholic beverage).

loans.name: G.s. Hermanos De Nagarote Group

texts.es:
EL g.s. Hermanos de Nagarote está conformado por tres personas integrantes, padres de familia, responsables, con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. En la actualidad luchan día a día para Salir adelante con sus diferentes negocios.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Deyanira y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva de forma ambulante  y por encargo. Como: pantalones, camisas, camisetas, faldas, shores, jeans.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas  diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería de ropa y aprovechar las fiestas patrias  y aprovechar las ventas. El g.s.  Hermanos de Nagarote agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Hermanos de Nagarote is made up of three members. They are parents, responsible, and responsible for ten children. They are originally from Nagarote, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. They are characterized as hard-working and responsible people who have a desire for self-improvement. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their children. Currently, they struggle day to day to come out ahead with their different businesses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to come out ahead, the coordinator is Deyanira. Her economic activity is the sale of new clothing on foot and by order, such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, and jeans. She works in her business some ten hours a day offering her product. The objective of the loan is to invest in work capital and supply her clothing merchandise to take advantage of the national parties and sales. 

The solidarity group Hermanos de Nagarote is thankful to the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries as is Nicaragua so that they have a means of work.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and to supply her business with new clothing, such as: pants, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, and jeans.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria y heladeria,la socia vende cuadernos,lapiceros y lapices,la socia ya tiene varios años en este ngeocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de libreria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She continues working in her bookstore and ice cream shop businesses. She sells notebooks, pencil cases, and pencils. She has been in this business for a number of years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to increase her bookstore business. She asks for a loan to purchase notebooks, books and pencil cases.

She is happy for the loan and commits to making the payments on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, books and pencil cases.

loans.name: Marka

texts.en: Marka is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Marka is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Marka will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Marka can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, vive en un hogar muy unido el cual está integrado por su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad; él es responsable de proveer a su familia con lo necesario para suplir sus necesidades; se dedica  a la crianza de ganado a tiempo completo, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres y lo práctica desde muy joven.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar concentrado para alimentar adecuadamente el ganado, espera mantener su negocio funcionando y tener mejores ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener una ganadería más grande y asegurar  que en el futuro sus hijos tengan buena educación.
texts.en:
Martin lives in a very close household which is comprised of his wife and three children, ages 8, 5, and 2. His is responsible to provide his family with what is necessary to supply their needs. He works raising livestock full time; it is a line of work he learned from his parents and he has done it since he was very young.

He will use the loan to purchase concentrated feed to adequately feed his livestock. He hopes to keep the business running and have better income.

His dreams are to have a larger herd and to assure that, in the future, his children have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed to adequately feed his livestock.

loans.name: Osiel

texts.es:
Osiel, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos, se esfuerza  por llevar a su hogar el sustento diario; desempeña el negocio de compra y venta de vehículos desde hace 20 años y heredo los conocimientos de su padre, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Invertirá en la compra de repuestos varios para los vehículos que compra y posteriormente vende en mejores condiciones y a un precio mayor, espera aumentar la popularidad de su negocio en el mercado y tener una mejor situación financiera. 
Para Osiel su visión es tener un aumento en sus ventas e ingresos de esta manera la calidad de vida de su familia será más digna y cancelara sus deudas.
texts.en:
Osiel is partnered and lives with his life partner and three children.  He works hard to bring daily sustenance to his household. He has run a business buying and selling vehicles for the past 20 years and inherited his knowledge from his father. His work schedule is from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon.

He will invest in the purchase of various spare parts for the vehicles which he purchases and later sells in better condition and at a better price. He hopes to increase the popularity of his business in the market and to have a better financial situation. 

For Osiel, his vision is to have an increase in his sales and income and, in turn, his family's quality of life will be more dignified and he will pay off his debts.

loans.use: to purchase various spare parts for the vehicles he purchases and later sells.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of hardworking women. Justine is 16 years old, and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past six months, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells salt, rice, sugar. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase salt, rice, sugar and other items, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase salt, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Harusi

texts.en:
Harusi is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and has children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby; he faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. John dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 20,000, he wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans to sell.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 23 years old, married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a construction worker, while she enjoys managing her retail business. 

Aiza sells a variety of grocery items in their village. She wants to extend the products she is selling, and has therefore requested a loan of PHP 18,000. She plans to buy more grocery items to increase her sales and income. 

She hopes to provide for her children's needs and to soon be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to increase her sales and income

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años vive en casa propia con 2 hijos a su cargo en el distrito de oyotún en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque este distrito se dedica a las labores agrícolas a la compra y venta de animales de corral y al comercio de venta de abarrotes.

José se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio con varios años de experiencia en este rubro solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para surtir e incrementar su bodega con productos de alta demanda en el mercado y así obtener mayores ganancias para su hogar, lo que le permitira mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and lives in his own house with 2 children in his care, in Oyotún district in Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque region. This district works in agriculture and the purchase and sale of farm animals and selling groceries. 

José works selling groceries in his own house, with a number of years of experience. In this line, he asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan to stock and increase his store with high demand products in the market and in this way get better profits for his household, which will permit him to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to have the working capital to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar fardos de ropa usada con los que tendrá un negocio más surtido, espera mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su cartera de clientes.
Para Silvia el financiamiento anterior le sirvió para que su negocio ofreciera a sus clientes nuevos estilos de ropa a muy buenos precios, su calidad de vida es más digna y ha cancelado su deuda.
texts.en:
Silvia needs a new loan to purchase bundles of used clothing with which her business will be better stocked. She hopes to improve her sales and expand her customer base.

For Silvia, the previous loan allowed her business to offer her customers new clothing styles at very good prices, her quality of life is more dignified and she has paid off her debt.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing, with which her business will be better stocked.

loans.name: Miguel Eugenio

texts.es:
Miguel de 63 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, no le fue tan sencillo, ya que tuvo que estudiar por las noches en la nocturna, la que les atendían de 4:30 a 6:30 p.m. ya que primero desempeñaba sus labores que le encargaban en su casa y luego se dedicaba a sus estudios, demostrando con esto las ganas que tenia de superarse, y fue así como supero todos sus obstáculos. Es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero que ha sido alguien que siempre lo ha apoyado en toda su vida, han procreado 4 hijos, quienes son mayares de edad, quienes han estudiado y preparado gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres. En casa solo vive con su pareja.

Él se dedica múltiples oficios es albañil, fontanero, agricultor,  carpintero; desde su juventud 
aprendió todo lo que sabe hacer hoy, la manera de aprenderlo fue fijándose como lo hacían las personas que  lo contrataban, ya que era auxiliar, cuenta con más de 25 años de ser una persona trabajadora la cual presta su servicios para quien lo solicite, al no estar contratado se dedica a la agricultura donde también lleva los granos básicos al hogar, las distancias que recorre son variantes, por lo que va a diferente lugares a donde lo contratan. El medio de transporte que tiene es una motocicleta en la que va a todos lados, el horario de trabajo que desempeña es de las 7 am a 4 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para apoyar a su hija con el pago de los gastos de su graduación en comunicaciones. La necesidad satisfecha, es el poderle apoyar a su hija y con esto sentirse siempre responsable de su paternidad.

Los sueños que tiene a futuro es poder dedicarse solo a dirigir trabajos, con toda la experiencia que tiene es fácil ser maestro de obra. Espera que sus hijos al igual que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Miguel, 63 years old, went to school to the ninth grade, which was not so simple, since he had to study at night in the night school, which is from 4:30-6:30, since first he had to take care of the work he was responsible for in his house and then focus on his studies, showing with this the desire he had to improve himself, it was in this way that he was able to overcome all the obstacles.  He is married, his wife takes care of the household tasks, but has been someone who has always supported him his whole life. They have had 4 children, who are adults, who have studied and prepared themselves thanks to the efforts of their parents. Only one lives in the house with his partner.   

He works in several jobs - his is a bricklayer, plumber, farmer, and carpenter. He learned all that he knows how to do today in his youth, the way he learned it was to pay attention to how the people who hired him did it, since he was an assistant.  He has been a hard working person for over 25 years, who offers his services to those who asks for them, and when he is not contracted, he works in farming where he also brings the basic grains to his household. The distances he travels vary, because he goes to different places where they hire him. His means of transportation is a motorcycle which he uses to go all over. His working schedule is from 7am to 4pm.

The loan that he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to support his daughter with paying the costs of her degree in communication. The need that will be met is to be able to support his daughter and with this, feel always responsible as a father.  

The dreams that he has for the future are to be able to work only in supervising work, with all the experience that he has, it is easy to be a foreman. He hopes that his children will also be good people.

loans.use: to support his daughter with paying the costs of her degree in communication.  The need that will be met is to be able to support his daughter and with this, feel always responsible as a father.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is a rural villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 35 years old, and a married mother of two school-age children. To strive for a living, she sells grocery items and she also plants cassava and rubber. She has been engaged with these businesses for 15 years. This is the third-cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid her past loans successfully. Her family’s condition of living is getting better and enough financial to support the family via her loans. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan, and she is a leader of two members. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for pigs and pig feed as her new business. She hopes her standard of living will improve so as she can support her kids to study until high level.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and pig feed as her new business

loans.name: Yessica Natalia

texts.es:
La socia Yessica Natalia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yessica Natalia continues working in her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, and has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She asks for a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy for the loan and commits to making the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motor for his boat.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, ha finalizados sus estudios y requiere capital para pagar los costos de su graduación, dar mantenimiento  su computadora personal y comprar laminas para reparar su vivienda. José ya no tiene el negocio de venta de comida rápida se dedica  a tiempo completo a su empleo en la unidad de salud.
Ha tenido beneficios con el crédito anterior, pues logro mantener el negocio de comida rápida funcionando para tener ingresos que le han servido para culminar su carrera, su familia se mantiene, sus nuevos proyectos son continuar preparándose académicamente  para tener mejores oportunidades en el mercado laboral y construir su casa propia.
texts.en: José has finished his studies and needs money to pay the costs of graduation, do some maintenance on his personal computer, and purchase metal sheeting to repair his home. He doesn't have his business selling fast food any more. He works full time in his job in the health unit.  He has had the benefits of a previous loan, and managed to keep his fast food business running to have income that has served him to finish his degree, his family is getting along, and his new plans are to continue with academic training to have better opportunities in the job market and to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his degree, do maintenance on his personal computer, and purchase metal sheeting to repair his home.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador desde niño a soñado con ser una persona diferente en la vida buscar la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico para ayudar a su familia para un ingreso económico para tener condiciones de vida adecuada, el tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero pero con grandes ambiciones hacia el futuro de su familia y la de el.

La actividad productiva que el dignamente realiza es la compra y ventas de abarrotería en su comunidad dicha actividad el lo ha venido realizando desde un tiempo de tres años  en la capital donde pudo ahorrar un poco de dinero para emprender su propio negocio para tener ingresos económico y ganancias impresionantes.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito es para la compra de mercadería para la ampliación de su tienda para servir a la gente en sus necesidades diarias. Los sueños más grandes de Salvador es la compra de 3 tiendas de abarroterías más para llegar a ser un comerciante con un futuro mejor y condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Salvador has dreamed of being a different person in his life since he was a boy, looking for a way to have income to help his family with an economic income to have adequate living conditions. He is 23 years old and is single, but has grand ambitions for the future of his family and himself. 

The productive activity that he does with dignity is the purchase and sale of groceries in his community. He has been doing this work for a time of three years in the capital where he could save a bit of money to open his own business to have economic income and impressive profits.

The use that he will give this loan is to purchase merchandise to expand his store to serve people in their daily needs. Salvador's greatest dream is to purchase 3 more grocery stores to become a businessman with a better future and adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en: Sunusi is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sunusi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children:Inusa,Jamila and Kabiru. Sunusi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sunusi will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Sunusi can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Sunusi is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.en: Mahmuda is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mahmuda joined Babban Gona primarily to make more money for his family. Mahmuda is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mahmuda will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mahmuda can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide better clothing and food for my family.” Mahmuda is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to be the most profitable farmer in my community. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, es soltero, vive solo, no tiene hijos, su madre y su hermano dependen económicamente de él, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero; inicio a cultivar granos básicos desde muy pequeño, lo hace con ayuda de su hermano, en ocasiones contrata mozos para agilizar su trabajo, su horario es de siete de la mañana  a tres de la tarde, aprendió el oficio de su abuelo, su ventaja es la experiencia que ya tiene y la mayor desventaja que identifica es un mal invierno.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, abono y herbicidas, para preparar la tierra en que realizara la siembra, espera darle el trato adecuado a sus cultivos y así obtener una mejor cosecha con la que tenga alimento suficiente para su familia y abastecer a sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son tener una mejor situación económica para darle una mejor vida a su familia e irse preparando para la próxima temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
José is a farmer, single, lives alone, and doesn't have any children. His mother and brother depend on him economically; he doesn't have any economic help from abroad.  He began to grow basic grains when he was very little; he does it with the help of his brother.  Sometimes he hires laborers to make the work easier. His work schedule is from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He learned this line of work from his grandfather. His advantage is the experience that he already has and the major disadvantage that he recognizes is a bad winter. 

The loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and herbicides to prepare the land where he will plant. He hopes to give his crops adequate treatment and in this way get a better harvest with which he will have sufficient food for his family and to supply his customers.

His aspirations are to have a better economic situation to give his family a better life and continue preparing himself for the next planting season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and herbicides to prepare the land he will plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc.,and also pay for renting the plot of land and for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a small covered patio in front of her house where her customers can be more comfortable.

loans.name: Windingoudi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZALISSA est la représentante du groupe WINDINGOUDI. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que les membres du groupe.  Mariée, elle est  mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et  le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est couturière. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 16ans. Mme vend aussi des bijoux et du savon. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de son quartier. 
Mme veut  s’acheter 06 rouleaux de popeline, 02douzaines de fermeture, 02douzaines de bouton.
 Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne  construire un atelier  de couture et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zalissa is the leader of the Windingoudi group. She and the other members of the group are doing fine. She is married with three children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is six. All three go to school and she has four people who are dependent on her.
Mrs. Zalissa is a seamstress. She has been in this profession for 16 years. She also sells jewellry and soap. She buys her stock at the market in her neighbourhood.
She would like to buy six rolls of poplin, two dozen zips, and two dozen buttons.
Mrs. Zalissa wants to save up her profits. Her goal is to build a sewing workshop and send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy six rolls of poplin, two dozen zips, and two dozen buttons.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Veuve  et mère de Trois(03) enfants, Adjo est âgée de 25 ans et réside à Agoè. Elle est revendeuse de pagne depuis 2012 par la vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier de résidence, et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de lomé.  Adjo sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce de pagne avec 02 pièces de Deluxe et d’Hitarget dans le but de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter de plus son bénéfice.
texts.en: Adjo is a widow with three children. She is 25 years old and lives in Agoè. She has been selling traditional pagne dresses since 2012 as an itinerant saleswoman in the region where she lives and goes to the big market at Lomé three times a month to stock up. Adjo requests a loan to expand her traditional clothing business with two items of Deluxe and Hitarget wax pagne models in order to satisfy her clients' needs and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy four models of traditional pagnes.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender ropa para tener recursos económicos con los que costea sus gastos personales y apoya en los gastos de su hogar, es soltera, vive con su hermana, ambas tienen  actividades económicas independientes; su negocio funciona desde hace 8 años, lo aprendió de su mamá, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, su ventaja es que ya tiene clientes establecidos.
Invertirá en la compra de blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, camisas y oras prendas de vestir para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, espera llamar la atención de nuevos clientes al ofrecer nuevos estilos de ropa, aumentar las ventas y ganancias, las que le servirán para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Su anhelo es tener una mejor condición económica para cambiar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maria makes a living selling clothing in order to finance her personal expenses and to support her household expenses. She is single and lives with her sister, though they each have independent careers. 

Her business has been in operation for the past 8 years; she learned about it from her mother. Her working hours are from 8 in the morning until 5 at night. She already has an established clientele, which is a great advantage. She hopes to bring the attention of new customers by offering new styles of clothing; therefore, she can increase both her sales and profit which will help her meet her payments. 

Her dream is to be in better condition economically so she can change her way of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, underwear, shirts, and ladies clothing in order to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza, vive  con un hijo, es soltera; como jefa de su hogar se mantiene trabajando en su venta de tortillas para tener recursos económicos, con los que pueda cubrir las necesidades familiares, el negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, a medida a pasado el tiempo la historia de su negocio refleja la buena administración ya que actualmente cuenta con 3 puntos de venta.
Invertir en adquirir materia prima, comprara maíz, leña, bolsas y cal para seguir elaborando la venta de tortillas, espera tener mejores ingresos para respaldar el pago de la deuda y seguir al pendiente de lo que en su hogar se necesita.
Su visión es aumentar la productividad de su negocio y cancelar su deuda con buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Lorenza  is single and lives with one son.  As head of her household she supports herself by selling tortillas. This is so that she can have income to cover the family's needs. 

She learned this business from her mother, and as time has passed, the history of her business reflects good management, as currently she has three sales outlets. 

To invest in acquiring ingredients and supplies, she will buy corn, firewood, bags and lime so that she can continue making and selling tortillas. She hopes to have better income, to enable her to repay the debt and continue looking after the needs of her household. 

Her dream is to increase her business's productivity, pay off her debt, and maintain a good credit rating.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, bags and lime so that she can continue making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan is a 38-year-old man who lives in a community of Prey Veng Province. He is a lovely father of two children who are enrolled in a primary school in the village. To make a living, he and his wife manage and operate a rice farmland which is located near his house. So far, they have been involved in this career for twenty years now. With great effort and hard work, this couple is able to make USD 5 in one day. Phan wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Due to inadequate funds, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Nesi

texts.es:
Nesi es una madre de familia dedicada, tiene 42 años de edad, 5 maravillosos hijos que son son mayor orgullo en la vida y por quienes día a día lucha para poder brindarles un futuro mejor. Es una persona muy conocida y respetada en la zona donde vive, ha sabido ganarse la admiración de sus vecinos.
Desde hace muchísimos años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto cultivado es el cacao, le va muy bien en sus ventas porque es una persona que siempre se preocupa por brindar productos de excelente calidad a sus clientes.
Nesi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado porque gracias a esto, ella podrá comprar semillas para ampliar sus cultivos, así como realizar el pago de mantenimiento y riego. De esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y Nesi podrá poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nesi is a mother who is devoted to her family.  She is 42 years old, and has 5 wonderful children who are her main pride in life, and for whom she strives each day to provide a better future.  Nesi is a person who is well-known and respected in the area where she lives.  She has known how to earn the admiration of her neighbors.  

For a great number of years she has worked as a farmer.  The main product she cultivates is cocoa.  Her sales are going very well, because she is a person who is always concerned about bringing excellent quality products to her customers. 

Nesi is grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support that they are providing, because thanks to this, she will be able to buy seeds to expand her plantings and also pay for maintenance and irrigation.  In this way, her income will increase, and she will gradually improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds to expand her cocoa plantings

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela es una joven soltera, tiene 22 años de edad y vive en San Martín junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven trabaja en los predios apoyando a sus padres para poder llevar un sustento económico a su hogar. Tuvo algunos retrasos en sus estudios, pero tiene muchos deseos de superación por lo cual a la fecha está por culminar la secundaria, porque más adelante quiere seguir una carrera universitaria.
Guisela se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente se dedica a los cultivos de cacao, maíz y plátano y le va muy bien gracias a su buen desempeño y a toda la experiencia que ha ganado a través de los años. 
Guisela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos como abonos naturales para sus cultivos, de esta manera obtendrá una mejor cosecha y sus ingresos mejorarán, mejorando así su calidad de vida. Quiere dar las gracias por todo el apoyo que ha recibido. Su meta a corto plazo es poder ampliar sus cultivos y convertirse en una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Guisela, 22, is single, lives with her family in San Martin and she has a desire to get ahead in life. She has been working in the fields supporting her parents from an early age, in order to provide financial support for her family. She has had some delays with her studies, but she wants to improve and she is about to finish high school. In the future, she wants to get a university degree.
Guisela works as a farmer, mainly growing cocoa, corn and bananas, and she is doing very well thanks to her performance and the experience she has gained through the years.
Guisela is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she will buy supplies such as natural fertilizers for her crops. In this way, she will get a better harvest and her income will improve, thus improving her quality of life. Her short term goal is to expand her crops and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (fertilizers) for maintaining her crops of cocoa, bananas and corn.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en: Agnes's group is comprised of hard working women. Agnes is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 6 months, Agnes has been working hard to manage her fruits and vegetables business. To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelons, which will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her siblings. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to join a saloon business. Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelons

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 21 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Oliva has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, beans, and soda. 

To help expand her business, Oliva has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential goods for sale, and will help Oliva to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her brother. Oliva hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another business. 

Oliva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential goods for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, by trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Fatuma is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She appreciates the support of her previous loan that helped her to boost her business and earn good profits to support her family, as she is the breadwinner.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Clorin

texts.en:
This is Clorin, 51, a resident of Sara, Iloilo, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. Clorin is one of the affected residents in the municipality of Sara by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Clorin operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5 - worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells direct selling products to her customer. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Clorin hopes to grow her business and improve her profit from it. She desires for more success and expansion of her business through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria Hilda

texts.es:
Gloria, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales ya son independientes; es propietaria de una venta de ropa ubicada en su vivienda, los días domingos sale a vender de manera informal al mercado municipal, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos estilos de ropa y unas láminas, con lo que mantendrá su negocio funcionando y reparara su vivienda, espera mejorar las utilidades y la capacidad de pago con las nuevas ventas.
Sus proyectos son mantener un nivel de vida digno y heredar a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Gloria  is married and has four children who are already independent. She owns a small clothing business located in her home. On Sunday she goes to the municipal market to sell as a street vendor. At the moment she doesn't have difficulties in her business.

She will invest the loan she is applying for in the purchase of new styles of clothing as well as some pieces of sheet metal, with which she will keep her business running and repair her home. With the new sales, she hopes to improve her earnings and payment ability. Her plans are to maintain a decent standard of living and pass on a better legacy to her children.

loans.use: To buy new styles of clothing as well as some pieces of sheet metal, with which she will keep her business running and repair her home.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married  woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Christine operates a charcoal selling business, where she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, Christine wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and seeds to cultivate corn and squash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar una vaca parida, para tener una mejor producción de lácteos, con la que da a su familia una mejor alimentación y puede vender otra parte para tener ingresos extras.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a realizar todos los procesos para recolectar la cosecha en menor tiempo, con ello sus ingresos han sido mejores y ha tenido alimento suficiente para su ganado. Su familia vive en mejores circunstancias, Kelvin ha enseñado a sus hermanos como trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería.
texts.en:
Kelvin decided to ask for a new loan in order to buy a nursing cow in order to increase milk production. He will be able to give his family better nourishment, and then sell the rest for extra income.

His previous loan helped him to undergo all the processes to harvest crops in less time, so his income has increased and he has had enough food for his lifestock. Now, his family lives in better circumstances, and Kelvin has taught his brothers how to work in agriculture and livestock.

loans.use: to buy a nursing cow in order to increase milk production

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef is a 34-year-old married father of two children; 10 and 6 years old. The village where he lives is known all along for the use of looms in which they make mostly qylims, decorative tablecloths, curtains, purses, cushions, and traditional costumes.

At the moment, Zef has four dairy cows, one sow with six piglets, and ten goats. He sells baby calves and baby goats and homemade cheese to locals and raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. 

In addition to all of the above, he’s got 9 dynyms of agricultural land (a dynym is a tenth of a hectare). On 4 dynyms he plants fodder for animals, on 3 dynyms he plants corn, and the rest are for seasonal veggies and he has already planted some olive trees. Zef does construction work as well whenever he gets contracts.

Zef is requesting this loan to build a new stable since the one you see in the picture is old and destroyed and animals sleep very poorly in it.

loans.use: to build a new stable

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Hello lenders!  Kennedy is a hardworking, ambitious and young farmer who is only 21 years of age.  He hails from Karaini village, a small village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya.  He comes from a very humble background, and has not managed to attend college, but that has not killed his spirit to succeed.  He has actively been involved in pig farming for the past year.  Although he has made great strides in pig farming, he wants to increase the number of pigs on his farm, and is kindly seeking a loan to buy more pigs.

Pig farming is one of the profitable agricultural ventures in Kenya and Kennedy, having an entrepreneurs mind, wants to take advantage of that and improve his living conditions.  Kennedy loves pig farming because pigs are not demanding to keep, unlike poultry that require special care and attention.  Kennedy believes that with the loan his life will permanently change because he will be selling pork meat to the ready market that is available.  As far as market of pig products is concerned, demand is greater than supply.  Kennedy always says, “To become a successful pig farmer you need three ingredients and that is getting the right breed, giving the right feed, and proper care."  With the loan he believes he will become a successful pig farmer and be able to realize his dream of transforming his life.

Having been a pig farming for the past year, Kennedy finds it very enjoyable because he does not spend more money on buying food.  Pigs feed on remains that can be collected from hotels and restaurants and hence save a lot of money.  Kennedy will also sell manure from the pigs and use it on his farm, also saving much more money and improving his living conditions.  Profits from selling pig meat to the local market and to industry that produce sausages and bacon will be used to fully repay the loan.  Kennedy's dream is to be able to save more money and improve his education by going back to college, as well as secure the future for his parents and himself.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 21 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Oliver has been working hard to manage  tailoring and sell clothes. 

To help expand his business, Oliver has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for the business, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and pay tuition for his sister. Oliver hopes that, in the future, he will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is a 58-year-old man who lives in Preah Sdach District, Prey Veng Province. He is a loving father of two dependent children who are enrolling in a primary school in the village as well as six married children. 

To make a living, he and his wife manage and operate rice farmland which is located near his house. So far, they have been involved in this career for almost forty years. With great effort and hard work, this couple is able to make USD 7 in one day.

Sarin wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Due to inadequate funds, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV, and radio. 

He is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Kelin

texts.es:
La señora Kelin  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus hijos y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de  8 años. 
Doña Kelin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, refrescos, queso, leche, azúcar, pan, galletas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder de esta manera atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Kelin espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Julio del  2014
texts.en:
Sra.. Kelin is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras. She has run her corner store for more than eight years and now needs a loan to buy butter, rice, beans, meat, drinks, cheese, milk, sugar, bread, cookies etc. Kelin hopes that sales will increase as a result of the loan as she will have more products to sell and be better able to please her customers.

She expects to cover the costs of daily necessities and improve a little her standard of living and that of her family. In a few years she hopes to see her business become one of the biggest and well known in the area so she can continue supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras--July 2014

loans.use: buy butter, rice, beans, meat, drinks, cheese, milk, sugar, bread, cookies etc. for her store

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zawadi cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ana Fermina

texts.es:
Ana, posee una venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 20 años, atiende sola el negocio de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, aprendió a realizar esta actividad junto a su madre; vive felizmente con su esposo y su hijo, ella aporta para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Le servirá para invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras, como repollos, zanahorias, aguacates, ejotes, fresas, etc., para ofrecer a mercadería fresca y de calidad a sus clientes, espera ampliar su negocio, mejorar el servicio a los clientes, tener mayores ventas e ingresos que le faciliten el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
Sus proyectos son expandir su negocio, dar a su familia mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Ana has owned a fruit and vegetable sale business for the past 20 years. She tends to her business alone from 7:00 am until 5:00 p.m. She learned the business from her mother. She lives happily with her husband and their son. She contributes financially to pay for household necessities.

She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables like cabbage, carrots, avocado, green beans, strawberries, etc. in order to offer fresh and quality products to her customers. She hopes to expand her business, improve service to her customers, and have better sales and earnings that will allow her to fulfill her obligations.

Her goals include expanding her business and providing better food, health, and clothing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables like cabbage, carrots, avocado, green beans, and strawberries so that she can offer fresh, quality products to her customers.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan es un joven soltero de 21 años de edad, vive en Santiago junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su familia es su mayor motivación en la vida, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles un mejor futuro. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en una empresa de Servicios, le va muy por su buen desempeño y gracias a la educación de calidad que recibió y a los valores que sus padres le inculcaron desde niño. Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado porque con esto él podrá remodelar su cuarto como pintarrajear las paredes y arreglar la puerta. De esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y continuará esforzándose para poder apoyar a su familia en todo y más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Juan is a young, 21-year-old man. He lives in Santiago with his family. He is a person with a great desire to move forward, and his family is his greatest motivation in life. He fights every day to be able to provide a better future for them.

He has worked in the service industry for more than one year. It is going well for him due to the quality education that he received and the values that his parents instilled from a young age. 

Juan is grateful for Kiva lenders for the support that they have provided because, with the money, he will be able to remodel his room by painting the walls and repairing the door. This way, he will be able to improve his quality of life, continue to make efforts to support his family and begin studying at university in the future.

loans.use: repair his room.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely, vive con su esposo y un hijo, en casa de su suegra, la vivienda es alquilada, el esfuerzo por salir adelante con su familia es mutuo con su esposo; su fuente de ingreso es un comedor, lo atiende lunes a sábado,  tiene una empleada que le ayuda en el negocio, el local es alquilado.
Comprará carnes, arroz, frijoles, verduras, embutidos, aceite, huevos, etc., son materiales necesarios para elaborar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes, espera sacar el mayor provecho de la temporada de vacaciones en el mes de Agosto y aumentar sus ventas.
Sus sueños son mejorar la situación económica y apoyar a su familia para tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Arely lives with her husband and their son in her mother-in-law's home, which is a rental home. She and her husband share the efforts to move their families forward. She works in a kitchen from Monday through Saturday. She has an employee to help her with her business, and she rents her location.

She will purchase meat, rice, beans, vegetables, deli meat, oil, eggs, etc., which are necessary materials to make food for her customers. She hopes to take advantage of the vacation season in August to increase her sales.

Her dreams include improving her financial situation and supporting her family so that they can have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase meat, rice, beans, vegetables, deli meat, oil, eggs, etc., which are necessary materials to make food for her customers.

loans.name: Ofelia Mabel

texts.es:
Ofelia, vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de su localidad, ella actualmente está soltera, es madre de seis hijos, vive solo con uno de ellos, los demás ya tienen  sus propios hogares; ya tiene 35 años de experiencia, ha progresado gracias a la ayuda de créditos y también por medio de ellos ha construido su casa.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de rábanos, tomates, fresas, papayas y más variedad de frutas y verduras frescas con las que surtirá su inventario para la época de vacaciones, espera aumentar las ventas y mejorar las ganancias.
