loans.use: purchase coffee, sugar, beverages, corn, lard, meat, rice, bread, milk, eggs, cheese, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bands, discs, grease and lime for his business.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de bebida como: sodas, jugos, gatorade y  agua además vende  fruta picada como: sandía, mango, etc., el negocio lo tiene desde hace 11 años, su mamá le enseño el oficio, trabaja sola en un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, ya tiene una cartera de clientes establecidos. Actualmente está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de 6 años.
El capital le será de ayuda para comprar variedad de bebidas, una hielera, bolsas, etc., para abastecer diariamente su venta y mantener sus clientes satisfechos, espera atraer nuevos clientes, tener mayores ventas e ingresos con los que resarcirá su deuda.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación de calidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
María sells various types of drinks such as sodas, juices, gatorade and water, and in addition sells chopped fruit such as watermelon, mango, etc. 

She has had the business for 11 years. Her mother taught her the occupation. She works alone from the hours of eight in the morning to five in the afternoon and already has a list of steady customers. Currently she  lives with her life partner and a six-year-old son. 

The loan will be a help to her in buying a variety of drinks, a cooler, bags, etc., in order to stock her business on a daily basis and keep her customers satisfied. She hopes to attract new customers and have greater sales and income with which she will pay back her debt. Her dream is to support herself by working, so that she can give her family a better diet, clothing, health, and for her son, a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a variety of drinks, color, banks, etc., in order to stock her business on a daily basis.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. 

She has done hand embroidery work for 5 years and makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in demand and she has managed to build a customer base that allows her to contribute to the household expenses. She has requested 40,000 PKR to buy thread, sequins and stones. This would help her to cater to her customers. She expects to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

She dreams for a bright future for her children and desires to build her own house because she currently  lives in a rented house with her family. 

She is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy different colored thread, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself as spiritual. 

She operates a retail business to sell milk and fish. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use 70,000 KES to buy milk and fish. She hopes to  buy a house in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy  milk and fish.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a married woman with 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. 

She has successfully run a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field.  Her husband purchases goods from the market because he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her customers. She is expecting to increase her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar is a married woman with 8 children. She has run a general store for many years and operates the shop with her son.  

In order to earn more profit, she has requested 45,000 PKR to buy rice, grain, tea, spices, shampoo, and soaps.

She hopes that increase in her business capacity will ultimately help to generate more revenue. She dreams of providing a bright future to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, grain, tea, spices, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Fiaz

texts.en:
Fiaz is a 40-year-old married woman who has sold milk for 8 years. She owns 3 cows and 5 calves. She sells milk to many of her neighbors. Fiaz also makes butter and cheese to generate extra revenue. She looks after the cattle and collects milk  while her husband sells it  on a daily basis. 

In order to make more profit, she has requested 40,000 PKR to buy another cow. She is sure that the increased milk production will help to generate more revenue. 

She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a married man with  6 children. He describes himself as optimistic and operates a retail business to sell meat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and he serves commercial businesses and individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as financial. He will use the 20,000 KES to buy meat. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to uy more  meat.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a maize farmer farmer. As a Babban Gona member, Aminu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Aminu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Aminu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Aminu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; baby, and baba. Aminu’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Cristian Miguel

texts.es:
Cristian de 35 años de edad, padre soltero, con un hijo menor de edad, originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente,  se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carreta y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para cumplir sus sueños y metas.  
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas  como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, meneítos, dulces. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  La rutina de trabajo de este hombre es de unas doce horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos,  y aprovechar las ventas  por la mañana y mantener la clientela. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Cristian agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cristian, 35 years old, is a single father of a young boy. Cristian is from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. Cristian is hardworking, responsible, and has a strong desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, he was not able to go to college because he needed to begin working at a young age. Cristian has been working day in and day out to achieve his goals. Thanks to his hard work and his desire to get ahead, he owns a small store that sells small quantities of food items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, juice, cookies, cheese puffs, candy, and detergent. 

Cristian's business is located in his house. He works 12 hours each day offering his products and taking advantage or morning sales and keeping his customers. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock Cristian's business so that in the near future he will be able to increase his earnings. 

Cristian is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders are offering to other with scarce resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have a dignified way to make a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his store with food items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, ham, juice, cookies, as well as detergents.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is a farmer from the village of Nor-Kharberd of Ararat region. Her family consists of her mother, father and brother. Farming is the only source of income. 

Syuzanna raises cows and hens, and grows tomatoes and peppers. As the family's needs grow, Syuzanna wants to increase the livestock and cover the needs of her family more effectively. 

A loan of 1,500 USD will be a huge support to the family and will enable them to purchase feed, 2 oxen and pesticides. Syuzanna and her family appreciate the lender's support in helping them with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for feed, 2 oxen and pesticides.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in the village of Qarakert in the Armavir region.

She is an experienced farmer and lives with her husband, son, and father-in-law. She is self-employed and raises cattle and grows tomatoes. This is the only source of her family’s income. Narine's husband and son help her by selling the tomatoes in the local market. 

The family needs 3,000 USD to continue to grow tomatoes and purchase 4 calves. 

Narine and her hard-working family will be grateful to the lenders for helping them with the loan.  This will greatly impact their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to purchase 4 calves.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 47-year-old man married to Mary, who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They have been blessed with four children.  Henry has been operating a vehicle repair shop for five years and earns an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Henry was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES. He intends to use the entire amount to buy additional window screens, tires, and brakes to add to his current stock, which is running out.

Henry plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional window screens, tires, and brakes

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a Babban Gona farmer from jaki. Matiyu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Matiyu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Matiyu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Matiyu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Matiyu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Matiyu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Samuel que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el es de 38 años de edad  que tiene 3 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad, el segundo de 6 años de edad también estudiante y un último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Samuel ha venido realizando desde hace 20 años es la plantación de café y el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Samuel es para la construcción de su casa ya que en las condiciones en las que el vive y su familia no son las adecuadas para poder vivir y eso lo motivo a realizar su préstamo.

Samuel quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la compra de terreno para dejárselos a sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the country, so it’s good to know that there are people who care for the environment as part of their business.  Such is the case with Samuel.  From a very young age, Samuel had the desire to grow plants in his community.  He is 38 years old and has three children.  His oldest child is 9 years old and a student in the community.  The second child is 6 years old and also a student.  The youngest child is two years old and not in school.  

Samuel has been planting coffee since the age of 20.  He learned the trade from his parents and this is the only legacy that they were able to leave to him.  For this reason, he spends his time doing the same type of work, which provides an income that helps to support his family.  

The purpose of this loan is so that Samuel can build a house.  The conditions under which he and his family currently live are not adequate, which is why he is requesting this loan.  Samuel wants to be different from his parents.  One of his greatest aspirations for the future is to buy land that he can leave to his children so that they can live in adequate conditions.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 60-year-old farmer from Nasarawa. As a Babban Gona member, Ali is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ali can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ali is ambitious and is aiming to reap 100 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ali said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ali is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks to sell

loans.name: Gañaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Gañaloma está por 8 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por el cantón de Nabon este sector es de clima frió, está rodeado de grandes montañas y hermosos paisajes, la actividad económica de su gente es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes cargos los que les permiten solventar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Las socias al igual que toda su población son personas ambles, gentiles y su tesoro más preciado es mantener su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Deisy, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido ha concebido una hija de 2 años y medio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en donde viven es arrendada por lo que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca pero los fines de semana se trasladan a su Cantón.
Doña Deisy trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica, en el cantón Nabon de donde es oriunda tiene animales, los mismos que les cuida su madre cuando ella no se encuentra, tiene ganado del cual vende la leche y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de una vaca lechera. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gañaloma Communal Bank is made up of eight women members and one man.  They live in Nabón Canton.  The region has a cold climate and is surrounded by big mountains and beautiful landscapes.  The people there work in agriculture and raising animals, and many work in the city in various jobs so they can pay their household expenses and get their families ahead.  The members, like all the residents, are friendly and nice people, and their most precious treasure is preserving their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Deisy, 19.  She's married and has a two-and-a-half-year-old daughter.  Her husband works in construction.  The house where they live is rented, so they live in the city of Cuenca but go to their canton on the weekend.

Deisy works as a housekeeper from Monday through Friday.  In her home canton of Nabón, she has animals that her mother takes care of for her when she's not there.  She has cows (she sells their milk) and guinea pigs.  She also works in agriculture.

The money from her loan is to buy a dairy cow.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Karem Margarita

texts.es:
Karem vive junto con su madre en una casa, su madre por problemas de salud en muchas ocasiones no puede trabajar y ella muy consciente de la situación de su hogar inicio rápidamente a vender productos pro catalogo lo hace en su colegio era muy insistente pues quería ayudar a su madre.
Una vez termino su secundaría inicio con una tienda con la que puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar y ayudar enormemente a su madre, aparte de esto estudia una técnica en auxiliar en enfermería pero su sueño es hacer la profesionalización para ganar un buen salario y construir junto con su madre la casa de sus sueños.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido para su tienda como víveres ejemplo; frijol, arroz, panela, aceite, café, verduras como zanahorias, cebolla, papas, etc. etc. 
Con el crédito podrá seguir produciendo capital para pagar su estudios y ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Karem lives with her mother in a house.  Her mother, for health reasons, often can't work and, very conscious of the household situation, she began quickly to sell products by catalog in her school and she was very insistent because she wanted to help her mother. 

Once she finished her secondary studies, she opened a store with which she can cover the household expenses and help her mother enormously, apart from this she studies in a technical school as a nursing assistant, but her dream is to get a professional degree to earn a good salary and to build the house of her dreams with her mother.

She asks for a loan to purchase a variety of goods for her store such as beans, rice, panela (jaggery), oil, coffee, vegetables such as carrots, onions, potatoes, etc. etc.

With the loan, she will be able to continue to produce the capital to pay for her schooling and help her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her store such as beans, rice, panela (jaggery), oil, coffee, and vegetables such as carrots, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en: Zakariya remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Zakariya like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Zakariya,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Zakariya expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Zakariya is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Chincha junto a su cónyuge.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrero en una Empresa de chatarreo y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y trabaja muy duro para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para el cuarto alquilado en el que vive, gracias a ello tendrá mayor comodidad y vivirá de manera tranquila. Así seguirá esforzándose y en poco tiempo podrá concretar un objetivo trazado: "Comprarse una mototaxi"
texts.en: Juan is a young entrepreneur. He is 20 years old and lives in Chincha with his spouse. He is a person who is eager to succeed. For the last few years, he has worked as a laborer in a scrap metal company. He is doing very well because he always strives to do his best and work hard to provide a better future for his family. Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided he will be able to buy a bedroom set for the rented room in which he lives. As a result, he will be more comfortable and will live in a peaceful manner. He will continue to work and soon will be able to reach a stated goal: To buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: Buy furniture for his room.

loans.name: Richard Alex

texts.es:
Al poner un pie en la pequeña finca de don Richard te das cuenta del buen cuido de su hogar y de sus animales más preciados, sus vacas. Él se muestra agradecido por el de financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, ya que gracias a este logró mantener su ganado en forma. Lo que le  permitió obtener alimento para el hogar y al mismo tiempo  ser un medio de ingresos económicos, todo esto mediante la venta de los animales. Es un señor generoso y trabajador, con más de  seis años de trabajar en el cuido del ganado y en construcción de carreteras, tiene 39 años de edad, junto a su esposa, velan por el bienestar de sus dos hijos. 
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando y que su ganado siga en buen estado de salud, don Richard solicita un segundo crédito para la compra de alimento de ganado, requiere de pasto, melazas, entre otros. Anhela que el fenómeno del niño no afecte con el comercio de su ganado, puesto que espera incrementar la producción de su capital de manera que  pueda seguir prosperando y así mejorar las condiciones de vida. Uno de sus planes futuros es elevar el número de ganado y al mismo tiempo de sus tierras, trabajará hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Upon setting foot on Richard’s small farm, you notice how well he cares for his home and his most precious animals, his cows.  He is appreciative of the Kiva funding through MiCrédito as, thanks to this, he has managed to keep his cattle in good shape.  This allowed him to get food for his household and also be a means of income, all by selling animals.  Richard is a generous and hardworking man with over six years of work experience in caring for cattle and building roads.  He is 39 years old, and together he and his wife take care of the welfare of their two children.

With intentions of continuing to prosper, and keeping his cattle in good health, Richard is requesting a second loan to purchase livestock feed, fodder, molasses, and other items.  He hopes that “el niño” doesn’t affect his livestock trade since he hopes to increase capital production so that he can continue to prosper and, in this way, improve his living conditions.  One of his plans for the future is to increase his number of cattle and his land at the same time.  He will work until he achieves his goals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, fodder, molasses, and other items.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik is from Yeghegnut village of Armavir region.

Nazik is an experienced farmer from the village of Yeghegnut of the Armavir region. She lives with her elderly mother-in-law, husband and son, who is currently a migrant worker.

She and her husband are the ones who take care of the family. The most important source of the family's income is the livestock of cows, pigs, piglets and hens, and the cultivation of tomatoes, corn, beans, potatoes and grass. As the family’s needs are growing day by day, they need to enlarge their agribusiness a bit to be able to live on it. Nazik needs a loan of $3000 to purchase two oxen, forage and fuel for land cultivation. The hardworking family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their support in gathering the needed amount of financial resources to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, forage and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 27-year-old man married to Marline, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child. James has been operating a motorcycle transport business for one year, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

James was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 15,000 and intends to use the entire amount to repair his motorcycle, which has technical challenges.

James plans to use the anticipated income to pay for school fees for his child and hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle which has some mechanical challenges.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is an experienced farmer from the village of Surenavan of Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband and two children, a son and daughter each 21 years old. To be able to take care of her large family's needs, she is engaged in the cultivation of corn and cucumbers and some fruits, including peaches, plums and apples. Her family helps her a lot in running the agribusiness. Her son and husband help her in selling the products in the local market. To continue the usual agricultural activities, Anahit needs some financial resources. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling them to purchase fertilizer, fuel and cover labor costs. Anahit and her family will be grateful to the lenders for their goodwill in supporting them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel and cover labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Celsa Kiora

texts.es:
Celsa  Kiora, mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser reproductivamente comercial y turística donde predominan, el comercio, ganadería, agricultura y minería, entre otros,es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consisten en la venta de frutas y verduras como: plátanos verdes, maduros, cebollas tomates, entre otros todos, negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central de esta localidad, sus compras son al contado a camiones distribuidores y sus ventas son al contado tambien, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios productos de sus trabajo anterior el cual tuvo que emigrar para lograr formar un pequeño capital y montar su negocio buscando una forma digna de poder sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, Celsa se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, celsa por faltas de recursos económicos no logra terminar sus estudios y uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales y construir muy bien un tramo donde tiene ubicado su negocio, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para así aprovechar a los clientes que asisten temprano a realizar  
sus compras, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de frutas y verduras principalmente Plátanos y así obtener mayor utilidades y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Celsa Kiora is an adult single mother with three children who are minors and still under her care. She is from one of the northern municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country, a zone that is characterized as being commercially reproductive and touristy, where trade, livestock, agriculture and mining predominate, among others. 

She is a small business owner and the manager of her own business, which consists of the sale of fruits and vegetables such as: green bananas, ripe bananas, and onions among others. Her business is located in the town's central market. She makes her purchases in cash from the distributors in pickup trucks. Her sales are also in cash. She has permanent customers and temporary customers. She started her business with her own funds and products from her previous job, in which she had to migrate in order to raise a small amount of capital and build her business. She was looking for a dignified way to raise her young children. 

Celsa is an enterprising woman, hard-working, responsible and eager for self-improvement. Due to a lack of economic resources, Celsa did not complete her studies. One of her dreams is to be able to see her children become professionals and construct a lot where she can locate her business. She begins her workday very early in order to take advantage of the customers who come early to do their shopping. The goal of this funding is to invest in working capital in the purchase of fruits and vegetables, primarily bananas, and thus obtain greater profits and better serve her clients.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables, mainly green and ripe bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase laptop bags and satchels for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is an agronomist from Dimitrov village. She lives with her husband and son. To be able to meet the everyday needs of the family, Alvard is engaged in breeding livestock, particularly pigs and chickens and cultivating wheat, tomatoes and grass. Her husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products in the market. As life gets more expensive, the family's everyday costs are also increasing. Alvard now needs to renovate the greenhouse, which is damaged, to be able to meet her family's needs more effectively. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support to Alvard and her family, helping them to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizer. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agribusiness. This is Alvard's first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric material for making skirts

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is from Shahumyan village, Armenia. She lives with her husband and son. Leyli, with the help of her family, breeds livestock and cultivates tomatoes and peppers. Livestock breeding and plant cultivation are very important sources of income for the family. 

To be able to continue it, Leyli needs a loan of $3,000 (USD) to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and to cover labour costs. Leyli has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately she wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Leyli was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Leyli and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and to cover labour costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric material for making clothes

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is aged 34 years. She is married with one child who is going to school. She has been selling clothes for the 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes, and the profits from the business will be used to improve their welfare.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing material, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal no se deja por vencido por los obstáculos de la vida porque el quiere emprender otro tipo de negocio abriendo nuevos campos en la vida el es de 29 años de edad soltero que quiere tomar las condiciones de vida como un reto para poder superar y llegar a ser alguien importante en todos los aspectos de su vida laboral y dejar como herencia a sus hijos el trabajo que en un futuro les enseñara.

Cuando no tenía acceso a un crédito las condiciones de vida de Cristóbal no eran las adecuadas el comenta y agrádese a personas que lo han ayudado a realizar su préstamo pues ahora el ya cuanta con agua potable en su casa para el uso de su familia.

La inversión que el le dará al nuevo préstamo es para la compra de materiales par la elaboración de dulces artesanales para llevar un poco de dulzura al paladar de su comunidad que día con día se esfuerza para tener un ingreso económico y obtener ganancias que tanto les hace falta para mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Las metas futuras de Cristóbal es la construcción de una casa para sus hijos y familia que tanto les hace falta ya que las condiciones que ahora viven no son favorables ni adecuadas para poder vivir.
texts.en:
Cristóbal has not been defeated by the obstacles in life because he wants to undertake another type of business and open up new opportunities in life. He is a 29-year old bachelor who wants to take the conditions of life as a challenge to overcome and to become someone important in every aspect of his working life. He wants to leave, as a legacy to his children, a profession that he will teach them in the future. When he didn't have access to credit, the conditions of Cristóbal's life were not fit to speak of. He is thankful to the people who have helped him obtain a loan.

He already has drinking water in his home for his family's use. Upon receiving his new loan, he will invest in the purchase of materials for artisan candy-making to bring a bit of sweetness to the palate of his community. Every day he strives to have an income and obtain the profits he needs to improve his living conditions. Cristóbal's future goal is to build a house for his children and family, which are both lacking, since his current living conditions are not favorable or suitable to live in.

loans.use: Buy materials for candy making.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is aged 38. He is married with two children, aged 9 and 3 years old. Both of them go to school. His wife is an accountant at the petrol station. He has been a motorcycle driver for the past ten years. 

With the loan, he would like to make reparation/spare parts for his motorcycle. The profit from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un tero en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros es el caso de Cornelio que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia el apenas tiene 21 años de edad soltero y tiene 2 hijos por la cual el realiza actividades artesanales para dar estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.

El trabajo que el realiza en su comunidad donde el vive es la venta y producción de productos artesanales ya que genera una ganancia económica para el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la de el. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad apoyando a las personas que requieren de sus servicios pues el lo hace para tener un ingreso extra del trabajo que realiza.

El uso respectivo que el dará el préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de productos artesanales para luego venderlas en su comunidad y en todos sus alrededores, las metas de Cornelio en la vida es la construcción de su casa para que el y su familia tengan una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Guatemala is well known for its hardworking people who seek to get ahead in life, and take things as they come in order to achieve their goals. This is true for Cornelio, who has had to be resourceful in order to earn an income for his family. He has just turned 21, is single, and has two children. He makes handicrafts so that his children can go to school and become professionals. His work involves the making and selling of handicrafts in his community, which allows him to earn money to sustain his family and improve their quality of life. Cornelio also works in his community for people who need his services and pay him for his work, which provides him with some extra income. 

Cornelio plans to use the loan he is requesting to buy handicrafts to sell in his community and surrounding areas. His goals are to build a house so that he and his family can enjoy suitable living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore, a 28-year-old married mother has been photographed with her 3 and 2 year old adorable kids. She practices agriculture/livestock for a living and with the loan that she is requesting from you she wants to add three more female pigs; currently she already has three. In addition to the pig animal husbandry she’s got grapevines and chickens as well; she sells grapes and chickens and eggs. Her husband works as a cook in a nearby restaurant. She promises that she will pay back this loan on time knowing how responsible she is.

Vitore and her family live in the suburbia of a little town created in 1959 that used to be very industrial under the communist era. With the collapse of the regime all plants were closed down and the town was no more considered industrial and many residents were struggled for work afterword.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs.

loans.name: Ledia

texts.en:
Last year, when her husband was incarcerated, Ledia was forced to pick up the pieces and continue her family’s business, GMZ Trucking.  Both Ledia and her husband received their trucking licenses in the early 2000s and began driving for other companies. After learning the ins and outs of the business, the couple purchased their first truck and started their trucking company in 2003. 

GMZ trucking is licensed to haul deliveries to 18 states within the U.S. Their coverage area includes all of the states surrounding Texas, reaching Indiana and extending to Tennessee. With the help of her two children, Ledia is able to keep her trucks running in good condition. 

“Without my husband, I had to handle the business on my own,” Ledia said. “I was really frustrated and was ready to quit and do something else.”

One of Ledia’s trucks broke down and she started to experience financial problems. After attending a small business finance workshop at a local university, she sought the help of Accion Texas Inc. to cover the maintenance of her trucks. Ledia needs extra income to help fix up her secondary trailers and to buy new tires for existing trucks. 

“In the beginning, it was difficult adjusting to working without my husband,” Ledia said. “I thought I was not going to be able to do this without him.” With her trucks in top condition and her backup trailers fixed, Ledia will be able to continue receiving loads to deliver from carrier brokers. 

“I am so happy our business has a second chance,” Ledia said.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her trucks, such as tires, oil changes, and fuel.

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es:
Niños y niñas son los que con mucho entusiasmo llegan al negocio de doña Susana, todos en busca de helados y frescos naturales, siempre acuden a ella por el sabor y la calidad de producto. Son atendidos con mucha paciencia y cortesía.  Esta señora trabajadora tiene 44 años de edad, está soltera y tiene cinco hijos, todos mayores e independientes, cada uno le brinda ayuda en el negocio, puesto que están muy agradecidos con ella, pues ha luchado por el bienestar de todos. Hace 20 años inició en el negocio de venta de helados, refrescos naturales y carne de cerdo, en el que poco a poco ha progresado
Tiene muchas esperanzas que su negocio siga en auge, razón principal por la que solicita el crédito, requiere comprar  frutas, tales como naranja, melón, papaya, guayaba, entre otras; también, azúcar, bolsas de plástico y carne de cerdo. Una de sus metas es incrementar la venta de cerdo para  satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, que día a día aumentan el pedido del producto, por esta razón deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, su ideal es crecer. Es una mujer con sueños, entres sus planes futuros esta mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar de manera que su familia se desarrolle con excelentes condiciones.
texts.en:
Boys and girls love going to Susana's business in search of ice creams and fresh juices. They always go to her because of the flavour and good quality of her products. She serves them with patience and courtesy. This hard-working woman is 44, single, and has five children, all of whom are independent adults. All of her children help her with the business, as they are very grateful to her for having fought for their well-being. 

She started the business 20 years ago, selling ice creams, fresh juices, and pork, and it has gradually grown. She is hopeful that her business will continue to grow. The main reason she is requesting the loan is that she needs to buy fruit such as oranges, melons, papayas, and guavas, among others. She also needs sugar, plastic bags, and pork. One of her goals is to sell more pork in order to meet her customers' needs, as there is a growing demand. For this reason, she is placing her hopes in financing, as she wants to grow her business. Susana has many dreams; improving the structure of her home so that her family can live well is one of her future plans.

loans.use: to buy oranges, melons, papayas, guavas, sugar, plastic bags, and pork.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: This is Lek, a 53-year-old married father of two who is requesting this loan to buy a machine for the opening of tires; he is a mechanic/tire repairman by profession and owns his own shop in a little town in the northern Albania. In addition to his shop, with his wife they do agriculture; he’s got two dynym (1000 m²) agricultural land planted with grapevines and one dynym planted with olive groves. Lek sells to locals homemade red wine and pickled olives. Lek makes money from his mechanic shop, yet recently, both of his children were accepted to local universities; he had to pay their tuition fees with the money he had put aside.

loans.use: to invest on a machine for the opening of tires for his autoshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Tameka

texts.en:
Don’t call Tameka’s Hawaiian ice a snow cone. As the new owner of Tropical Sno, she says her ice is different, packing flavor with every bite. 

“Shaved ice is much different from a snow cone, in that it is made by a small counter-top machine that shaves ice, rather than grinding it like a snow cone machine,” Tameka said. “The ice is so fine, it could be mistaken for real snow.”

Growing up, Tameka always loved snow cones. Now, as an adult, she is gearing up to officially open her stand in the next two weeks. She works full time on an Alabama military base as a civilian employee. Because there are limited choices of food on base, Tameka believes her Tropical Sno will be a hit.
 
“Hawaiian ice isn’t just for children,” Tameka said. “It’s hot out here, and my cold treat is a nice break away from the seriousness of the workday.”

Tameka said her team will include herself, a manager, two assistant managers and one employee. Her daughter Tiara will join the Tropical Sno team as an assistant manager. Tameka said she is excited about her family business. 

“I would love for my daughter to run her own stand someday,” she said. “She is majoring in business, and this would be a perfect way for her to get hands-on knowledge.”

Tameka came to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to purchase the equipment, such as cups, spoons, napkins, Hawaiian flavoring, and ice shaving materials, needed to start her business. A portion of the loan will also be set aside for marketing and advertising, including signage and flyers.
 
“My main goal is to focus on getting started and being successful for these next few months, while it is hot,” Tameka said. “Tropical Sno will go full force next season in March.”

loans.use: to pay for cups, spoons, napkins, Hawaiian flavoring, ice shaving materials, signage and flyers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pests traps and hire labourers to weed the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 36 años de edad, vive en una pequeña comunidad al norte de Nicaragua y desde hace algunos años se dedica a la producción de café en su pequeña finca de 4 hectáreas. Tiene 4 hijos en edades de 4 a 19 años, los cuales estudian en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Este ciclo de café, esta pequeña emprendedora además de gestionar un préstamo para las actividades de mantenimiento de su parcela, también está solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un beneficio húmedo que le permita mejorar la calidad de su café y disminuir las pérdidas por rendimiento, esto como parte del plan de inversiones que se ha propuesto para ir mejorando su pequeña finca.

El sueño de esta pequeña emprendedora es contar con una finca modelo donde pueda continuar manejando de manera semi-tecnificada su producción, y ampliando su área de café para incrementar los rendimientos de su cosecha y con ello los ingresos para garantizar las necesidades de sus hijos, y brindarles a ellos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old, lives in a small community in northern Nicaragua, and has been earning a living for several years by producing coffee on her small 4-hectare farm. She has 4 children from 4 to 19 years of age who go to school in the community.

For this coffee cycle, this small business owner is requesting a loan in order to build a wet-processing plant, in addition to a loan to assist with her crop. The plant will allow her to improve the quality of her coffee and decrease losses. This is part of an investment plan that Maritza has proposed in order to continue improving her small farm. 

Maritza's dream is to have a model farm where she can continue managing her production using some technology, and to expand the coffee growing area in order to increase yield and income, so that she can meet her children's needs and provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to build a wet-processing plant.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.es:
Un sol radiante y un aire refrescante le brindan los buenos días a don Thomas, un señor agricultor que a diario sale de su casa al campo para realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol. Con mucha energía y entusiasmo labra la tierra y le proporciona los cuidados necesarios para que el producto sea de calidad, puesto que es de su interés el bienestar de sus clientes. Tiene 59 años, está casado y tiene siete hijos, todos mayores e independientes, quienes le proporcionan su ayuda en el negocio. Hace 22 años inició en la actividad, por ser miembro de una cooperativa fue beneficiado con un terreno, con las ganancias obtenidas ha ido comprando sus vacas y tierras. 
Con anhelos de seguir prosperando don Thomas solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar alimentos a las vacas, necesita pasto, melaza, entre otros, de modo que estas puedan sobrevivir la temporada de sequía; al mismo tiempo planea invertir en la pulpería de su casa. Su prioridad es proporcionarle a su familia salud y educación de calidad, razón por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. Entre sus planes futuros esta comprar más tierras para incrementar la siembra y así obtener mejores ingresos. Con mucho esmero don Thomas dará lo mejor de sí para cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Bright sunshine and refreshing air greet Thomas each morning, a farmer who leaves his house daily to the fields to plant corn and beans. With energy and enthusiasm, he plows the soil and provides the required care to generate a quality product, since the welfare of his customers is his concern. Thomas is 59 years old, married and has seven children, all grown up and independent, who provide their help for his business. 

Twenty-two years ago he began in this line of business. For being a member of a cooperative, he was granted land, and with the resulting proceeds he has been buying his cows and land.

With a desire to continue to prosper, Thomas is requesting a loan to increase the productivity of his capital, which requires buying food for the cows. He needs grass, molasses, etc., so that they can survive the dry season; while also planning to invest in his in-home grocery store. 

His priority is to provide quality health and education to his family, which is why he puts his trust in the loan. One of his future plans is to buy more land to increase his crops and generate better income. With great care, Thomas will do his best to fulfill his objectives.

loans.use: buy food for the cows he needs grass, molasses, among others.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años casado con una familia que mantener se a decidido realizar otro segundo préstamo porque la demanda de cebolla a crecido en estos últimos mésese es por ello que el quiere aprovechar estas oportunidades que se les están presentando en la vida, para poder sembrar mas cebollas en sus terrenos disponibles y también para que le generan más ganancias para el y para el beneficio de su familia.

Cuando el no tenía acceso a préstamos las condiciones de vida no eran adecuadas no producía casi nada de cebollas pero todo eso cambio porque  ahora cuanta con mas siembras de cebolla y las ganancias son mejores como antes y eso a podido cambiar un poco en las condiciones de vida de don Juan.

La inversión que el realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de semilla de cebolla para luego sembrarlas en sus terrenos disponibles, los cambios que los préstamos a podido realizar en la vida de Juan son muy importantes porque en la actualidad tiene más siembras de cebollas.

Las metas de Juan es la construcción de su propia casa para tener condicione de vidas adecuadas en conjunto con su familia y darles educación a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 36, is married with a family to support so he decided to take out a second loan because the demand for onions has grown in recent months. He wants to take advantage of these opportunities that are presented in life. He'd like to plant more onions on his available land to generate more profits for himself and for the benefit of his family. 

When he had no access to loan, his living conditions were not adequate. He produced almost no onions and all that change because, with more onions planted, his earnings are better than before and the conditions of Juan's life have changed a bit.

The investment of the new loan is for the purchase of onion seeds that he will plant in his available land. The changes that the loans can make in Juan's life are very important because today he has more onions planted.

Juan's goals are to build his own home to have appropriate living conditions for his family and give an education to their children so that they can become professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase onion seed

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Flor es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Más que Vencedoras, en este grupo se encuentra desde hace 10 años, ahora es la presidenta y le gusta por la solidaridad y compañerismo, todas se apoyan mutuamente. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se caracteriza por las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, la amabilidad de su gente, su centro se mezcla entre la arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.
La Señora. Flor tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 20, 12 y 10 año, su primer hijo está trabajando y ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como técnico mecánico de maquinas de costura, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña Flor es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a varias actividades para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene una tienda y cría ganado, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, se dedica a la agricultura que es para la venta y para el consumo de su casa, también se dedica a la preparación de comida. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y víveres para su tienda. Su meta es continuar creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Flor is a kind, gentle woman who belongs to the communal bank  Mas que Vencedoras.  She has been a member of this group for 10 years and now is the president.  She likes the companionship and solidarity of the group, the way they provide help to each other.  Flor lives in downtown Azogues, a city known for the able hands of its artisans and the courtesy of its people.  The downtown area is a mixture of colonial and modern architecture.  The people still maintain the traditions and culture of their ancestors.

Flor is 42 years old, married and her fruitful marriage has produced 4 children, ages 21, 20, 12 and 10.  Her oldest son is working and helps financially; her second son is married and lives away from home.  Her third child, a daughter, is in high school and her youngest son is in a small school in the city.  Flor's husband works as a technician fixing sewing machines.  She does not own her own house and thus lives with relatives.  

Flor is a hard-working woman who works in several fields to help her family progress.  She has a store and she takes care of cattle, pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  She works at farming both to sell and for consumption at home.  Flor also works preparing food.  The money from her loan will go to buy pigs and  a supply of food to sell in her store.  Her goal is that her businesses will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a supply of food to sell

loans.name: G.s 12 De Enero Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario 12 de Enero esta conformado por  3 integrantes, Ana Maria, Maritza del Socorro y Marlon Enrique,  todos  mayores de edad, casados, con  hijos los cuales solo uno aun esta bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias del departamento de Chinandega municipio de Chinandega, Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Maritza quien es la coordinadora del grupo solidario la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de grupo y de las cuotas de pago en tiempo y forma. es una microempresaria y administradora de una hermosa pulpería la cual consisten en ofrecer productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, fósforo, café, pan, huevos, detergentes,productos congelados, gaseosas, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias, jabón, entre otros mas. sus compras son al contado y sus ventas al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer mas su negocio y tener mejores utilidades. El objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es  para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, productos congelados, pan,detergentes,entre otros y de esa manera lograr cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. El grupo solidario 12 de Enero agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group 12 de Enero (12th of January) is made up of three members: Ana Maria, Maritza del Socorro and Marion Enqrique. 

All are older, married, and with children, only one of whom is still under their responsibility. They are natives of the Chinandega department, city of Chinandega, a place located in the west of the country.

Maritza is the solidarity group's coordinator, which means she takes charge of the group's responsibilities and the payments in time and form. She is a microentrepreneur and administrator of a beautiful grocery store, which consists of offering everyday products in small quantities, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, matches, coffee, bread, eggs, detergents, frozen products, soft drinks, toilet paper, sanitary pads, soap, among others. 

Her purchases and sales are in cash. She has regular and occasional customers, and starts her workday very early to give better attention to her customers. One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business more and have better profits. 

The goal of this new loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with household products, such as rice, sugar, beans, oils, frozen products, brea, detergents, and others. In this way, she will be able to cover customer demands. 

The solidarity group 12 de Enero thanks Kiva investors for the help they bring to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have sources of work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of household products, such as staple goods, frozen products and soft drinks, among others.

loans.name: Pine

texts.en: This is Pine, who is requesting an amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek to build a fence around her house. She has completed almost half of the fence but it is unfinished yet as she has no money. Pine is a 54-year-old married mother of three who lives in the northern part of the country with her family. She has been raising livestock for a living since 1990; currently she has two dairy cows and one sow; she sells baby calves and piglets to the locals and also raw milk to some nearby dairy farms. In the area where she lives, there are many dairy farms and they produce all dairy products such as cheese, butter, cottage cheese, yoghurt and cheddar cheese. Locals also sell olive oil, honey made of chestnut and heather, watermelons and turkeys - almost every household has turkeys.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house so that animals from her neighbours cannot enter and destroy her plants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit fly traps, fertilizer as well as hiring labour for weeding and pruning the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire labourers to weed, prune and harvest his crops

loans.name: Sung

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Sung has been in the clothing industry, both as an employee, as well as an employer. Sung prefers being an employer. 

“I like sharing the money that I make from my business,” Sung said. 

Sung owns AJY Inc., which does business as Fashion City in Dallas. Sung employs three part-time workers. His store offers contemporary casual and dressy clothing, as well as accessories for both men and women. 

Previously, Sung owned and operated a wholesale clothing business for six years. He had been looking for a way to get back into business ownership. So two years ago, when a friend offered to sell Fashion City through an owner financing arrangement, Sung thought it was a great opportunity. 

“He was a good friend and it was a good deal,” Sung said.

Occupying a large commercial space in a shopping center in Dallas, within walking distance of several apartment complexes and next to a beauty supply business, Fashion City is in a good location, and business is good. 

Sung needed more inventory to get ready for the start of the school year, but wasn’t able to obtain a loan through a conventional bank. An agent with a financing company told him to apply at Accion Texas. 

“It was a good experience,” he said. “I would like to continue building a good relationship with Accion Texas.”

Sung said he would like to build his credit through this Accion Texas loan, and eventually wants to open another location. When he does, he will ask his wife to operate it and will apply for another Accion Texas loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the clothing store and increase his working capital

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael started out his wholesale/reselling business as a regular at local swap meets, where he and his father would watch intently as other vendors moved their merchandise, soaking up information like a sponge. Then, one day, after his father received four trash bags full of used fishing equipment in exchange for helping an elderly woman, Michael and his father started the business that would one day become Price 2 Go, LLC, out of their garage.

Michael had caught the “fever” that anyone in his business will tell you is the key to making it in the wholesale/reseller industry. One day, he found himself at a trade show talking to a representative of a large manufacturing company that supplies many of the country’s largest retailers. This chance meeting led to Michael being put on an email list that ensured he would get the best prices on goods that had been overstocked by major retailers. He was on his way.

Though he is a persistent optimist, Michael is the first to admit that being an entrepreneur is challenging. It was a challenge to form relationships with people along the supply chain, to find merchandise that will sell, and to get that merchandise out the door. Most challenging, by far, was when Michael’s then girlfriend (now fiancée) had a medical catastrophe that left her largely incapacitated. Michael says she is his motivation to make the business work. 

Needing an infusion of capital to get his business to the next level, Michael will use his Kiva loan to purchase more inventory that he can turn around quickly for about four times the amount he paid for it.

Not one to get discouraged when things don’t work out, Michael is a ball of energy, always focused on what comes next. With the help of Kiva lenders, Michael will continue to grow the business and provide for his new family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory that he can turn around quickly for about four times the amount he paid for it

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Es poco común ver a una mujer ser la dueña y propietaria de los campos y más aún cuando su único empleado es su esposo junto con él han logrado constituir un humilde campo con el que pueden comer y generar ingresos para mantener a sus 3 hijos, pero en vista de los constantes cambios climáticos y la poca seguridad del sector han perdido mucho cultivo y sus ingresos se vieron muy afectados.

Requiere un crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar la tierra, como abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y semillas para recuperar lo que fue sus tierras y poder mantenerse junto con su esposa en el oficio que tantos años sustento les ha brindado. Su sueño es progresar y cada día seguir mejor o poder envejecer con su marido en esta hermosa profesión.
texts.en:
It is not very common to see a woman as the owner and manager of a farm, especially when the only employee is her husband. Together the borrower and her husband have built a modest farm from which they can feed themselves and generate income to support their three children. As a result of constant weather changes and the lack of security in the area, they have lost many crops and their income was adversely affected.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies to prepare her land such as compost, fertilizers, seeds, as well as to pay the cost of irrigation. This will enable her to recover what was her land so that she and her spouse can support themselves in the same way they have done over the years. Her dream is to make progress and continue improving each day so that she and her husband can grow old working in this cherished profession.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build her online store and get her business started

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 25 años se gana la vida con la venta de comida que realiza en su pequeño negocio ubicado en el mercado central, además los fines de semana vende pupusas en su colonia lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra. María desea  ampliar su negocio de venta de comida en el cual vende productos  tales como: pollo, carne, arroz, ensaladas, pescado, etc. Por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos como: arroz, aceite, carne, pollo, verduras, etc. para el negocio y poder así contar con los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los ricos platillos.
texts.en:
María, 54, lives with her family.  She is an enterprising woman who has earned a living for 25 years selling food that she makes at her small stall in the central market.  On weekends she also sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) in her community in order to earn extra income.

María wants to expand her food business, where she sells chicken, meat, rice, salads, fish, etc.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy supplies such as rice, oil, meat, chicken, vegetables, etc. for the business and have the necessary ingredients on hand to prepare her delicious dishes.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, meat, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel mayor de edad casada con cinco hijos los cuales todos son independientes, originaria de Chinandega ubicada en el occidente del país, Ana se caracteriza por ser una mujer que ha trabajado desde muy joven para lograr salir adelante a pesar de no haber estudiado y solo haya aprendido a leer y escribir ha logrado que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y terminado sus estudios, Ana es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la elaboración y comercialización de cajetas de cocos y venta de agua helada de cocos, negocio el cual tiene ya mas de 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de venta, anteriormente ella tenia una pulperia pero a raíz del cambio de domicilio perdió clientes y tuvo que cerrarla pero tiene la voluntad y deseos de volver abrirla en el nuevo domicilio, ya que este era otro medio de ingresos mas para su familia, inicia su negocio de elaboración y venta de cajeta gracias a donde ella laboraba el cual aprende este oficio y le dio la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio los cuales vende en paquetitos los cuales entrega a diario en  escuelas, pulperias, farmacias entre otros lugares los cuales son clientes fijos de ella tambien sale a vender de forma ambulantes a clientes eventuales, sus compras son al contado, a comerciantes carretoneros que se dedican a intermediar la fruta, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos los cuales logra recuperar quincenalmente lo invertido, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo mas en su negocio poner nuevamente su pulperia y seguir mejorando su vivienda, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos como: cocos, azúcar, roda mina,papel de envolver, canela, leña entre otros mas para la realización de las deliciosas cajetas de coco. Ana Isabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel is an elderly, married woman with five grown children. She is from the Chinandega area in the western part of the country.  Ana is a woman known for having worked since she was verry young to get ahead, despite the fact that she was unable to get an education and only learned to read and write.  She has been able to give her children an education.   She has a small business making and selling coconut caramels and iced coconut milk.  She has been in business for over 20 years and used to run a grocery store.  But when she moved she lost customers and had to close the store.  She wants to open a new one in her home because it is the way to earn most income for the family.  

She started her caramel business after working in a place where they make them.  She sells little packages to schools, grocery stores, pharmacies and to other fixed customers.  She also works as a street vendor, selling to regular and prospective customers. She purchases goods in cash from fruit dealers and sells to her customers in cash or on credit, collecting every 15 days.  One of her goals is to continue expanding and to open a new grocery store so she can renovate her house.  The goal for this loan is to buy products such as coconut, sugar, firewood, markers, wrapping paper, cinnamon, firewood and other products for her coconut caramels.  Ana Isabel is grateful to Kiva lenders who support people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy raws materials such as coconuts, firewood, sugar, wrapping paper, markers, etc.

loans.name: Haydee Graciela

texts.es:
Haydee es una joven emprendedora, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, desde hace casi un año trabaja en la Municipalidad de la zona donde vive y le va muy bien gracias a su buen desempeño en el trabajo y a que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Haydee está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes y cambiar la cerradura de las puertas para que su familia pueda vivir en un ambiente más seguro, gracias a esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Haydee is a young entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, single, and lives in San Vicente with her family. She is a woman with a lot of desire to excel; she has spent almost a year working in the Municipality area where she lives. She is doing very well thanks to her strong performance at work, and because of her ability to always strive in everything that she does.

Haydee is grateful to the lenders at Kiva because with the support they have provided she will be able to remodel her home. She will paint her walls, and change the locks on the doors so that her family can live in a more secured environment. This will help her to better her quality of life, and to continue striving to take care of her family.

loans.use: to remodel her home

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, es un muchacho trabajador,  curso hasta últimos años de educación básica, está felizmente acompañado, su pareja se dedica al comercio de ropa, en la casa viven en armonía él, su mujer y su hijo.

José trabaja vendiendo ropa y cubrecamas de manera ambulante, la mercadería la compra a la suegra que es la que más experiencia tiene, José lleva ya 4 años dedicándose a esta labor. Aparte de esto José hace trabajos de albañilería y también siembra maíz, y es por eso que goza de buena reputación como persona trabajadora.

El préstamo solicitado, es para comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior de hombre y mujer, cubrecamas, ya que en este momento se encuentran un poco ajustado de dinero.

José sueña con terminar una casa que está construyendo, pues en este momento vive en una casa que le pertenece al hermano, además le gustaría ampliar su negocio de modo que pudiera tener sus trabajadores y así cubrir más zonas de distribución.
texts.en:
José, 33, is a hard-working person who has an elementary education.  His common-law wife sells clothing and they live in harmony with their son.

José works as a street vendor selling clothing and bedspreads.  He buys the goods from his mother-in-law who is the one with the experience.  He has been working in this trade for four years.  He also works as a bricklayer and grows corn, so his reputation as a hard worker is well-founded.

The loan he is requesting is to buy men's and women's blouses, pants, shirts, underwear and bedspreads, as he is running low on funds right now.

He dreams about finishing the house that he is building since he currently lives with his brother.  He also wants to expand his business to hire workers and cover a larger distribution area.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's blouses, pants, shirts, underwear, and bedspreads.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es una socia que participa activamente del grupo de crédito Mas que Vencedoras, este grupo de crédito le gusta porque con el dinero que recibe puede crecer poco a poco en su negocio, en cada reunión comparte gratos momentos con cada una de sus compañeras. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se caracteriza por las hábiles manos de sus artesanos y la amabilidad de su gente, su centro se mezcla entre la arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.
La Señora Ana tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de huevos de codorniz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Ana desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta huevos de codorniz, estos huevitos los vende cocinados y recorre toda la ciudad, le gusta esta actividad porque le da la oportunidad de ser su propio jefe y contar con dinero a diario. Esta repitiendo el crédito porque quiere comprar huevos de codorniz para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a member who takes a leading role in the credit group 'Mas Que Vencedoras'.  She enjoys being part of this group because the money she can get helps her to build her business bit by bit.  At each meeting, she has a pleasant time with all of her colleagues.   

She lives near the center of the city of Azogues.  This city is well-known for the skilled work of the artisans and the friendliness of the local people.  The center of the city is a mix of colonial and modern architecture.  The people still maintain the traditions and culture of their ancestors.
 
Ana is 27 and is married.  She has two children aged seven and two.  Her first child studies at the local school.  Her husband sells quail eggs on the streets.  They don't have their own house so they are renting.

Ana has been selling quail eggs for several years.  She sells them already cooked and she offers them around the city.  She enjoys doing this because she can be her own boss and earn a daily income.  She is asking for a repeat loan because she wants to buy more quail eggs continue her business.

loans.use: to buy quail eggs.

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: Rafatou est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et exerce comme activité la vente des produits de première nécessité (les condiments). Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et  elle revend au marché d’Atsanvé où elle détient un emplacement pour sa vente.Rafatou sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock avec 2 sacs de d’oignon et un sac de potasse afin de répondre aux attentes des clients et faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en:
Rafatou is the married mother of three children, and lives in the Agoè neighborhood. She is 35 years old and has a business selling food staples (condiments).

She resupplies three times a month at the main market in Lomé and retails at the Atsanvé market where she has a stall for her sales.

Rafatou is requesting a loan to expand her stock supply with two bags of onions and one bag of potash, to meet customer expectations and make considerable profits.

loans.use: buy two bags of onions and one bag of potash

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: María Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo Mas que Vencedoras, vive por el centro de la  ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se caracteriza por las hábiles manos de sus artesanos y la amabilidad de su gente, su centro se mezcla entre la arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres. Le gusta su grupo de crédito por la solidaridad y el compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias, siempre están dispuestas a brindarse una mano en lo que necesiten.
La Señora. María tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos es casado y vive independiente, sus dos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios de manera privada, la casa en la que vive es propia
